title: HAve you experienced Ayuaschsa?
text:
Or are you curious about this spirit of the soul, the vine of life? To be quite honest I have only experienced Aya, one time, but that was enough to confirm that there is and are other dimensions, and other spirits out there, who are here to help us evolve as individuals, and as a society. I experienced it for the first time, and only time in Costa Rica, almost a year ago to this date. I am sitting here listening to a web cast of Joe Rogan and Graham Hancock right this moment,(an amazing talk by the way) hence the inspiration to reach out on this medium to others that might have experienced it. 

My experience was incredible, in so many cosmic ways, I am not going to get into all the juicy details here, but let me say that I felt like I was one with the jungle, and the leaves, and the vines, and animals and spirits, like I never was before or since. I miss that feeling, that connection, and I would like to find someone who is at least open to experiencing this incredible plant spirit together some day...

Me? I am a writer, a published writer who has written two, sci fi, spiritual-fantasy, novels. Ironically most of the content of my novels takes place down in Costa Rica, which is where I spent a year of my life recently. I miss Costa, I miss the rugged invigorating beautify of her jungles, and oceans and rivers and waterfall. I crave a sensual soul, who I could get lost with in the jungle of love, of passion of nature, together with, I dream of her on a daily basis. 

I dream of frolicking naked under tropical waterfalls, or paddling, on a beautiful river, or on a desolate bay, or in the cave behind my very own special waterfall. I dream of sharing this deeper, divine connection with that special someone, every single day of my life, and I have a feeling that someday soon, we will unite. I have written about here extensive in my novels she is my Ying and I am her Yang. I am the strong masculine, alpha, and she is the divine, sensual, goddess, and together we make magic. We balance each other perfectly, much like the balance that can be found on the Sea Saw of life, if we are fortunate enough to find that bliss. I know I deserve it, I crave it... do you?

I am ready to humble myself, to be the man I was always meant to be, to cherish her, and love her, and to reach a deeper level of consciousness then I have ever experienced. I really do believe that together, anything is possible, anything is achievable, I can help you to see things, to experience things you have only ever imagined.... will you help me to see the things I want to see and feel? I hope you will....

title: Dinner and a cocktail ???
text:
First...... if your a pro keep looking. Not interested!!!!

Now, for any real ladies looking to meet for dinner and a drink, here goes. I am looking for a lady to have a nice conversation over dinner. I would love to hear about your job, your kids, your husband........whatever. Just be interesting. 
I am in Colorado every month or so and I do not like to eat alone. I am married, have kids, a fantastic job, a stable mental status and have not been in handcuffs in (ohh so many) years. If your thinking this guy is crazy, I am, but I know it and that's 90% of the problem today. People think they are normal when they are total fruitloops. I can hold a conversation with a CEO or a homeless Vet ( and we should ALL have a conversation and help out our Vets, homeless or not ) and have that conversation really mean something. I am an interesting mix of Italian and just a touch of Polish, but the Italian really shows. 
Faults: Im overweight, bald, and have a hard time seeing the Bad Things in anyone (until they prove they are no good) but my character really outweighs any visual flaws. 
If your still reading this I think you are getting a sense of, perhaps he is not so crazy....... your intuition is working well. 
Ok, so why post here? He's looking for sex. 
Well, here comes the Italian showing!!!! Fugettabout it........ I am not trying to sleep with you, or any other form of naked recreational activity. I am an extremely clean, safe, almost to the point of germ-a-phobe type of guy so the thought of body fluids and disease transmission just....... well enough, Just not interested in sexing you up (or whatever they call it today) 
Want to sit and drink a 20 year old scotch and see how the flavors tease our tongues, now your talking..... flirt with me, tease, sure, I am a big tease myself. Want to laugh, cry or just unwind to a stranger (who is now your new friend) then I think you might have just found something worth putting together a nice email for. 
Next thought going thru your head (lets see if I'm good) This guy must be an Ogre, you know, Shrek looking. Why is he doing this, hideous looking man..... Well I am not hard to look at, but definitely not "easy on the eyes" pretty boy material. I am more the Tony Soprano looking type. Italian comes out again..... If you were out with the girls I would not be the first guy you approached in the bar, nor would I be the last. I fall somewhere in the middle. Talk with me and you'll be sorry you wasted those 12 mins of your life talking to Bernard, the "Hedge Fund Manager" that was wearing a $2,700 suit but wouldn't know how to put together an IKEA desk, let alone the IKEA bed he was trying desperately to get you into. 
OK, enough of the rant...... here is the plan. Lets discuss dinner, anything but Italian, unless you really, really want it. Send me a recent, real photo of you. Please don't be a Drop Dead Gorgeous Supermodel (all those things about not sexing you up and body fluids all become null and void) Please be a real and caring person. Married, Single, Widowed, Divorced....... I am not here to judge. Just be a nice person. I am here this weekend and back the end of the month also. I have a car, can pick you up, or meet you at the restaurant. (pick the meet me at the restaurant, If you'd get into a car with me after this post without meeting in public..... Im not sure I want to have dinner with you, your crazy) 
I have put some time into this, please do the same. Tell me a bit about yourself, your situation, your likes, dislikes...... I love Purple. Have you ever been arrested, and was it just a misunderstanding? You know, engage me somewhat. Make me feel good about buying you dinner at WaffleHouse.

title: Beyond the ordinary
text:
Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to read my post. For some time now, it's been clear my circle of friends has grown smaller, and those I do have are shifting. I am feeling less connected than many years ago when we began our friendship. Though they are dear to me, I am finding myself longing for a connection with another who values not only intellect, attending to physical body's needs (e.g. exercise, sustenance) but also has a desire to be better than he is today. I am seeking someone who finds gratitude in the smallest of things (e.g. the sunshine, the water, the contributions others have made to his life) and wants to share in that kindling of a new friendship to create new opportunities of gratitude and sharing

A little bit more about me: Single, blk, gay (though you do not have to be), 41. I like intimate coffee talks and smaller venues to get to know others, non-drug user, non-smoker to include 420, rarely drink. I also enjoy reading specifically books on dreams, hiking, exercise, good company, good movies. I find that for me it's not about the activities but the people I share those activities with that determine if I am having a good time.

Who I would like to meet: people with life experiences that have strengthened them but have also provided them with humility, those who know there is more to life than just the daily grind, those looking to connect with quality individuals and have their lives bettered for knowing another human in the world, those who have a great sense of humor but is also kind in their humor, and those who can challenge me to being a better person as I will challenge them out of my commitment to support others in being the best they can.

If interested, please say hello. Until our paths cross, I wish you all the best life has to offer.

title: Seeking a sisterly connection...
text:
I haven't met you... and I have no idea why you've chosen to read this. Perhaps your story is similar to mine, or maybe it's much different. I'm not sure what I hope will come of this, but it's a wish I'm brave enough to put out there. I know it's possible... I know that there is at least someone out there who has spent a lifetime wanting a sister to know deeply and be known deeply by... to laugh with, share secrets (and everything else) with, go on adventures with... trust and love. I believe that this is all possible because I know that family has nothing to do with blood and everything to do with how we treat one another... as an adult, it is a choice we have that we were not privileged with as children... we get to create our own selves into the people we want to be, and we get to choose for ourselves the people we want close to us, who we will call family. If you had a great family like all of us deserved growing up, perhaps you cannot understand... but then again, you're reading this, so maybe it wasn't as perfect as you hoped. 

I am hoping to find what I should have had... what was taken from me... what I've spent a lifetime wishing for. I'm a really good person, and a fiercely loyal friend. I have a lot of wonderful friends. But so many of them have sisters... and it's always an awkward conversation to have with someone who knows what it's like to have the thing you don't know what it's like to have. I don't want anyone to choose this connection because they feel sorry for me... I want them to choose it because they really want it, too, and it's something they have also wished for and hoped for and maybe never thought was possible. We've been led to believe that there are fences in this life, but there's not. So much is our free choice. 

Please send a note if you understand, and if you hope for the same.

title: Platonic Movie Date
text:
You know. . .dinner. . .movie. . .laughs. . .everything except the kiss at the end.

*crickets*

Lol. . .well excuUUUUuuuse me! This IS the platonic section after all! Don't get mad at me because you can't find someone in the personals section...get back in there! I don't care what you smell!

I have fun just going alone, but it's fun to make a dinner un-date out of it. Un-date...you know...just a casual meet up with no "omg, what do I wear?" or "Is he going to call me?" expectations. Just an hour of getting to know each other followed by a movie we both really want to see. (You know, as opposed to a date where one of us pretends to like the other's taste). Or we pick a "film"...watch it, and then discuss the themes over dinner.

Best case scenario: We click as friends and do it again.
Worst case scenario: I slip a roofie in your drink and you wake up the next day wearing a diaper and missing a few fingers. 

KIDDING. . .sheesh. . .when did serial killer jokes stop being funny? :-P

I don't care what you look like as long as you're close to my age, interesting, like to laugh, and SINGLE. I know, this is just platonic, but you'd be amazed at the drama and plans that have to get cancelled when we introduce spouses into the equation. If you wanna swap pics because you ran out of luck on the "romantic" side, that's fine, but don't hit me with the "pic please" email. Put a LITTLE effort into caring about my personality. :-P 

Movies I'd like to see: Hateful 8, Room, Daddy's Home, Revenant, Spotlight, Big Short

I have met my fair share of CL crazies, but for the most part, I've met a lot of really nice people through here....so here I'm giving it another whirl since there are some movies I want to see. Looking to go Saturday or next week. 

Edit - Apparently "Strictly Platonic" means "I want to date you" because that's all the responses I'm getting. I REALLY don't care what you look like, and I don't want to pay for you lol...I just want to go see a movie without any strings, or being judged on my pics - geez!

title: Calling all my fellow vegans!!!
text: Hello there to all my true fellow vegans (and all those interested) in veganism! I am a proud kid free vegan who made this compassionate and easier than I thought it would be switch this past summer (to all the awesome plant based foods and products out there in stores and online) looking for like minded people to be friends or roommates with who share this passion. It doesn't matter what sex, gender, color, ethnicity, height, religion, etc you are. (Unless you are a single handsome man who is vegan and likes to have sex, lol.) I am spiritual but not religious. LGBT are awesome people too! I don't discriminate about that stuff because I understand what it's like to be different or unique, discriminated against, and think outside the box. Being vegan is still rare/ in the minority but with my combined concern of animals and other causes I care about is what made perfect sense to make the change. The state that the world is in (animal treatment especially) will always be depressing unless it changes. How about you, what is your story? I am still learning and trying new products so if anyone has suggestions on what else to try I would love to know about it. I am a true animal person and willing to travel to meet. Which brings up my next question: Are any real vegans out there interested in opening up an animal sanctuary and/or growing organic plant based foods? I volunteer at animal sanctuaries already and would love to have a place to rescue animals someday (I'm currently unemployed) so if you have any ideas of how to go about this or interested in being a fellow vegan friend of mine great. Thanks for reading and ahimsa!

title: Humilated Steeler fan pays off debt
text:
Fellow Denver Bronco Fans!!!!!!

Go Broncos! We brought those ugly, arrogant Steeler fans to their knees, and today I am savoring our victory and looking forward to doing the same to the Patriots next week!

Now for the fun part: I won a bet with my die-hard Steeler-fan boyfriend (I am a transplanted female Bronco fan living in Pittsburgh), and as "payment" for the bet, he had to post the message below to the Denver Craigslist website, and will have to read any responses received to me (I would have had to do the same thing here if we had lost - and the best part is, it was HIS idea!!!!).

Here is what he wrote, which I approved:

--

Hello Denver Bronco fans

I am posting this to pay off a bet that I lost to my girlfriend over the Steeler-Bronco game yesterday. Our mutual agreement was that the loser would post this on the winning team's Craiglist site and read any responses received aloud to the winner.

I am a die-hard, life-long Steeler fan, and as such, love to talk trash on any of our opponents (especially Cincinnati, Baltimore, New England, and Denver). My girlfriend is originally from Denver, and "becomes nauseated" at my, and the entire city's devotion to the Steelers. Of course, I had no doubt that the Steelers would win yesterday, and for most of the game I taunted her about having to post and read all of the responses to me. I couldn't wait to see her annoyance and humiliation at being personally taunted by Steeler Nation. After that last fumble, my heart sank, and you can imagine the glee in her voice as I was now on the receiving end of her triumphant, taunting tirade.

My "punishment" is to expose myself to you as a Steeler fan, and humbly profess my homage and adoration of the dominant Denver Broncos and thier fans. You have undeniably demonstrated to me that you are the superior team, and I barely deserve to be on my knees at your feet. We are asking that you take this opportunity to remind me of how pitiful my allegience is, and let you know that your response will make a lifelong Bronco fan enjoy and prolong the agony of a lowly Steeler fan such as myself.

I am to tell you that I look forward to reading your responses to my girlfriend.

Humiliated Steeler Fan

--

I dreaded having to post a similar message to Pittsburgh fans, of which he constantly reminded me during the game, but when we pulled off our victory, he was almost in tears. I ask that you please respond and let us know what you would say to him, no matter how degrading it is, the more the better! He WILL read every word aloud to me, and I am hoping to make it last for hours.

Thanks!!!

title: New Friends?
text:
I am a 30 year old female, single, no kids and I work full time, Monday through Friday. I tend to be an introvert, however, I enjoy one-on-one conversations and am not shy. My idea of fun is to go to the movies, out for happy hour or even to stay in for an evening at home with a good bottle of wine and pizza. One of my other goals is to frequent the gym more often, however, I am not looking for a workout partner per se. Unfortunately, nor do I ski or snowboard or any of the other Colorado-y things that most people enjoy doing. My roots are in the southeast and I plan to relocate back that way at some point, however, I would still love to make new friends to enjoy the remaining time I have in the state.

I love to read....basically everything except sci-fi. I'm all about Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, Chronicles of Narnia but that is basically the extent of my interest in fantasy. My taste in movies and TV shows varies wildly from old TV shows like "I Love Lucy" to the modern like "The Middle". One of my favorite movies I saw recently was "In the Heart of the Sea" (despite the fact that I did manage to slog through "Moby Dick" and it was so boring). 

As I said previously, I do am not dating/engaged/married/have children. I am totally fine meeting up with ladies who are, however, I would prefer to meet someone who actually has available time to hang out and get to know each other. I do not smoke (cigarettes or otherwise due to my job), however, I don't mind if you do providing it is not excessive (I have known women who could not watch a full movie without stepping outside to light up. That is what I mean by excessive). I also would prefer it if you live in the Aurora/Centennial area unless you are partial to driving. It can get challenging to meet often due to traffic and commute times if we're both living on opposite sides of town.

If you think we might get along and you're looking to connect with a new friend in 2016, send an email my way!

Thanks for reading :)

text:
Hi!

I'm 29, m, happily partnered and have been involved with growing cannabis since I was 17. I have had the good fortune of trying cannabis and concentrate from lebanon, morocco, afghani, african (durban, swaziland, not the strains but actual flowers from these places) nepal, belize, mexico, aruba, curacao and a few other places I'm forgetting, oh yeah, Jamaican!! lol

Anyway, the point is, I am very well versed in LANDRACE genetics and am looking to network with people in LEGAL JURISDICTIONS to help support the preservation and propagation of these special genetics, which once lost to hybridization, exctinction, legal controls, etc CAN NEVER, EVER, EVER (seriously) be gotten back. You can NEVER beat what took thousands or millions of years to produce, all you can do is combine and recombine what IS ALREADY THERE. That means breeders only get to take credit for stabilizing hybrids, the magic COMES FROM THE LANDRACE untainted genetic pool. :) It's kinda a big deal.

I'm interested in ANY sort of collaboration. I'm a competent grower, preferring outdoors but capable indoors as well. I'm chemical-free entirely but that's not a pre-requisite for collaborations, just my preference (because why on earth would you taint rare genetics with synthetics salts, and X-icides, and all the heavy metals and carcinogens that go along with them?!?!). 

I'm open to assisting a grow or grows, acting as a seed repository where I will be happy to store seeds under ideal storage conditions (moisture, temp, light, air control), or whatever I can do to facilitate the protection of one of this planets greatest assets: It's heirloom cannabis genetic pool <3

I like healthy, voluntary relationships with people, who are respectful and easy going. I don't get along well with people who are unhappy, unfriendly, unkind, disloyal or egotistical. I like good energy and I avoid negative energy like the plague unless I see an opportunity to transmute that energy in to something pleasant or healing.

I used to be very spiritually, emotionally and physically unhealthy. Then I found cannabis, raw and traditional foods, and hermetics (ancient knowledge of quantum physics) and it flipped my life and perspective upright :) Now I just want to help others heal in all the areas I was (I say was, but there is a lot of remediation and healing to do in my spirit yet, this society is pathological by it's (unsustainably) consumptive nature) pathologically trapped with western brainwashing (skinner box, prussian (original nazi) schooling system, etc)

We have a chance now for a beautiful, free world, where we can do what we like as long as it doesn't harm others, let's help eachother make it happen!

PS: It shouldn't matter but I'm happily partnered with an amazing artist/model extrordinaire, we are in a poly relationship that is open to other dynamics and we work together to help eachother become successful in our respective fields of passionate labor. :) Thanks for reading, please email with greetings, encouragment, leads or just saying high! ;)

Hi =] My name is Danielle (26) and my husband (29) and I own a home in Aurora. I am a stay at home mom of my 8 month old daughter and looking for people to hang out with that have little ones themselves or don't mind me not really being able to get away alone. I'm pretty relaxed. I like to hang out at the house and bbq, play pool, movies, shopping (which I mostly mean walk around target for hours and end up buying the most random things I don't even need). Just because I am a stay at home mom does not mean I make my own baby food, cloth diaper, or baby wear 24/7. I get a lot of moms who want to hang out and then judge everything I do, so if that's you, don't even bother. I love road trips and seeing new places. I travel to California around 5 times a year and this spring i'm planning a long touristy road trip to Georgia =] I don't mind just being texting buddies either, I know how hard it is to get out of the house with little ones, esp in this cold weather. I don't mind wine/beer drinking/cigarettes but we are not drug friendly including pot.

Let me edit my post by saying NO MEN. This is posted as a strictly platonic woman for woman.

title: Non Binary seeking friends
text:
Anyone else constantly invalidated for who they are? I'm here to talk if you need someone to remind you that No matter how you portray yourself, no matter the clothing you wear, that you are deserving of love and friendship and joy. 

I am Me. 
I don't give a Shit that I have a vagina, I am Male. 
BREAK DOWN THE WALLS IN YOUR MIND THAT SOCIETY HAS FORCE FED YOU. Or don't and continue to spread hate. Up to you. 

But I'm choosing love. 
I am deserving of love. 
I deserve to be proud of my body and proud of my individuality and I should love myself too. 
I am More than my genitals. 
I am More than my breats. 
I am not an object, not a fasination, not a prize, and not a demon or Satan's child. I AM HUMAN JUST LIKE YOU. 

Your dick does not FORCE you go wear a blazer instead of a dress. YOU ARE CHOOSING THIS. and if that choice feels safe and pleasant with you soul that is awesome! 
My choice safed my life. My choice to love myself despite my brain not matching my body was an act of self love over self loathing. I feel safe and content within my mind when I embrace ALL OF ME. my femininity and masculinity. 

Be proud. Be queer. Be gay. Be non binary. 
Believe in yourself. 
Love yourself. 
Take care of yourself because no One else will. 
Be your own best friend Because everyone deserves a pep talk at their lowest and a high five at their best. Pat yourself on the back for being true to yourself. 

Embrace Autenticity with Me

title: It started with a wink and a nod
text:
As we stared across the room at each other, we knew we were meant to be friends. Even though we both knew we had rings on our fingers, it was risky to be seen together, but the risk was worth the reward. The reward of having a great friendship. Who knew a lady with heals likes to exchange those heals for a set of hiking boots and hit the trails. After a great hike, we stop at the local hot springs, you look stunning as we sit side by side in the hot water, snow all around. To laugh and have fun, perhaps stop and have a drink after a fun day together. 
I know it's all imaginary, but this or something like it could happen. 
Please don't judge me, I don't judge anyone for there position, we might be in the same boat after all!!
Maybe put a different twist to the story as well!

title: Did you just workout?
text:
Did you know

Massage improves your rebound time after a training session......FACT
Massage affects specific genes in the muscle cells.......FACT
The first gene reduces inflammation, the second gene turns up the production of mitochondria. What is mitochondria you ask? Mitochondria is the biochemical processes of respiration and energy.

As muscle cells become adapted to endurance exercise, the number of mitochondria increases. Massage helps this process along. 

Massage = FASTER muscle recovery.........FACT

Contact me to schedule a massage AFTER your next workout. I'm fit/young and can definitely help your muscle recovery.

7TwoZero EightEightFive 3ThreeSix5

title: Nudist friends
text:
Me and the wife are looking for other couples thats in to nudist house parties,sunbathing,camping or just hanging out we also have 2 young kids so if u have kids its ok to respond age, race, size, big or smale it doesen't mater.so Overcoming Your Fear of Social Nudity 
Many people have a deep seated fear of appearing nude in a public setting. In fact for many, it has been observed that only the fear of public speaking rivals public nudity for the power to induce sheer terror in the hearts of many of us. Still being nude in public holds a certain degree of appeal for many of us causing it to be an experience that some secretly long to try. If you've ever given thought to trying social nudity but feel that you are just too nervous to try it, allow me to offer some suggestions that might enable you to overcome your fear and embrace the joys of going au naturel.

Fear of public nudity is quite common and natural given that most of us have been socialized since childhood to feel that exposing our bodies in mixed company is wrong or even sinful. Coupling that with that the common fear of the unknown that most human beings have, one can quite readily understand why someone wouldn't be immediately comfortable with the idea of going nude in a communal setting. Phobias are usually best overcome by taking small steps. As a child you first learned to crawl, then to stand, then to take a few wobbly steps and much later you finally learned to run. This is a good method to employ in any endeavor that you feel is challenging and just a bit scary. Take your time and progress by taking small steps.

title: Almost Brocken... Almost...
text:
I lost my best friend, my dog about a year and half ago, and at that time, I knew times were going to be lonely and hard, but I didn't think those times would last this long. In the past few years, past several years actually I have had a series of bad luck, bad women, lying women, cheating women, scamming women, dishonest business associates, people who lied to me in so many ways... Most recently, a week ago actually, I went out on a date who I met on here. We had a nice dinner together, a hot make out session in my jeep afterwards, she told me I was a great kisser... and what happens?

She stood me up for the date we had the next afternoon, no texts, no call, no nothing....And so... Here I am alone in my place, in my life, wondering what I have done to deserve this? Seriously, I have wronged no one, in a very, very, very long time... I have not cheated, I have not lied, I always try and put peoples happiness in front of mine, and what happens? Nothing good, thats for sure... 

The only thing that is keeping me grounded and hopeful right now is a business venture, something I have been working on for over 15 years in one way or another. Maybe this will finally be the big break I have been hoping and praying for, for all these years... If it does not pan out in the next 2-3 months... I think I will just figure out a way to get out of this dark, cruel, evil world....Why am I writing this now, on here? I don't really know... Maybe there is a single, attractive woman out there who has had a similar streak of luck? Maybe there is someone out there who can identify... I don't know... I know I don't have much faith in the human race these days, that much I do know...

I used to drink myself out of these lonely feelings, but I quit doing that, as I realized that is no solution... So I am here, alert, not really tired, surely sober, and wondering to myself... what is the solution...I think to myself that I am either cursed, or I am to picky for my own good,... maybe I should lower my standards, I live a healthy life, I work out, I have a pretty tight body, and a very vivid imagination, a very artistic, mystical, compassionate mind....

Sometimes I think maybe I should not look for a woman who is in shape, who is exceptional in any way shape or form. Maybe I should date a "plane jane"... but the reality is... I can't...

title: In a sexless marriage

title: Long read. Apologies. m4w
text:
Well... Welcome to the novel I'm writing here on Craigslist! I know it's not the norm here to write such descriptive ads, but after looking through the ads, I've come to realize that all of the ads here are either pictures of someone's junk, or are severely lacking in what a person is looking for. 

To begin, I'm only here because I, like most here are lonely in life. Over the years I've seen my close friends find significant others, get married and sometimes have kids. I, on the other hand have chosen to focus on my career, become financially stable, advance professionally, gain respect among my peers, and plan for the future. Yes, I may have a 401k and a paid-off house, but it all came at a cost emotionally. 

The past decade has seen me travel to many different countries, experience different cultures and learn lots about myself as an individual. My friendship circle has barely reached beyond those that I met before this "journey of myself" through work, and is now dwindling to only those I can count on one hand. Anyone I have dated or fallen in love with over the past decade has either ended up, (most of the time unbeknownst to me) committed to someone else, or has been discovered to be leading me on in one way or another.

Along with being hurt relationship-wise, I have also had to deal with previous emotional trauma that makes it difficult for me to venture out. This doesn't mean I'm against meeting new people, nor am I fearful of it, but I am a little bit more cautious when it comes to trusting anyone. I've conquered my anxiety issues, but a bit of PTSD still exists from prior experiences. This does not mean I will flake at random times, as my integrity means I will follow through to anything I commit to.

Sad story aside, I don't seek pity, nor do I seek acceptance for my mental flaws -They are my cross to carry, and I'm dealing well. These issues are all part of the journey of life, and without them, it (and I) would be damn boring. All I'm seeking is someone to get to know, get to trust and experience life together with. 

If you aren't deterred by the sob story above, I'm happy you are still reading. 

If I were asked to describe myself, I'd say I'm unique (like everyone else...ha). I was raised a country boy, small town, genuine and a "call it like I see it" personality. I can't stand drama, I love giving shit to others, and I can receive it back like a champ. My idea of fun is a weekend fishing or hunting with like-minded individuals, or a weekend of exploring the wilderness in a 4x4 or 4-wheeler. I ride a motorcycle, have a truck and know how to gut a buck in near darkness (haha). 

To be honest, I'm a bi dude who leans towards dudes, but this ad isn't about sex. I'm an open book, and I'm honest about who I am. I'm here for a friendship, but if something beyond that happens, I'm game. I've had both girlfriends and boyfriends, and I loved all of them the same. All of my girlfriends broke my heart more than my boyfriends, so that may explain my leanings. That aside, If you tell me you're straight, bi, lesbian, asexual, gay, etc. I respect what you tell me. Since I'm a face-value type of guy, I don't make any moves past friendship, nor do I break up existing relationships. My straight and gay friends know about me, and trust me to not push - as do their significant others. I value friends over prospective "flings." -references are available upon request to back up that claim. Ha. 

So, with that mentioned, if you're a guy, I'm loyal as fuck and will back you up with my steel-toed shit kickers anytime you are crossed, and I'll never suggest anything outside of boundaries you establish. If you're a girl, I'll be that guy who will be there to talk, converse with and support you in every way a friend could -without me suggesting physical anything unless YOU suggest otherwise. If you're asexual, same above and I won't question the way you are made, and enjoy the interaction. If you're in a committed relationship, I'll be the best buddy I can be to support both you and your significant other, since you'd be a package deal in my mind.

Quite simply, I'm an educated, bearded grizzly-Adams type guy who is lookin for great people to share experiences with. I may live in the city, but I'm far from it. I'd love to find other like-minded people to start a friendship with. I can't be the only country guy (or gal) forced to move to the city who meshes. 

Yeah, I'm long winded, but at least I'm honest. What am I looking for? Someone to enjoy life with. Movies, eating out, hiking, fishing, hunting, off-roading, cars/trucks, music, political debate, cartoons (lol), etc... These are all things I'd love to experience with someone other than myself. 

If you're into a steel-toe wearing, blue-collar pickup truck driving type of guy, I may be what you're looking for. I have vices like anyone else, so get off your high horse. I drink, I chew and I socially smoke...I'm more than my vices though. And yeah, I gots baggage, but who the hell doesn't? 

If you're interested in a friendship or more, I'm amazed as fuck, so definitely send me a message. Tell me something interesting about yourself, and maybe we can meet up for a beer or good bourbon. I'll guarantee I won't have any pretenses past a good conversation and feeling out our personalities out for a match. Nothing to lose? As for you, I typically gravitate towards those around my age and younger, but if you're "young at heart," I'm all for seeing what we have in common. 

Send more than one sentence. I want to know about you! Have a great day/night/etc!

title: Looking for a good friend
text:
Hi my name is Adam. Since this is a CL personal's ad, let me first be clear on one point: I am NOT on here looking for sex. Not now, not down the road once you know me better. If that's what you think friendship is, well there are (and unfortunately from my viewpoint) a lot of posts from people who agree with you. Try them.

Now that that is out of the way, let me tell you a little of who I am and why I AM posting on here. It will be the first time I've done so. I'm posting on here because I believe the world we live in makes deep and intimate human connection difficult and therefore hard to come by, at least for me. Honestly, I don't know how to build a real friendship when for many people, the occasional "like" on Facebook or "LOL" text message constitutes friendship. That and all the rules that forbid men from getting close to one another physically, emotionally, spiritually, or any other _ally unless they are into homosexuality. Sorry, but I reject both the notions of superficial non-connected friendships as well as the opposite that "real men" only interact in fist bumps and bro-hugs and don't actually have any kind of feelings or need for anyone but themselves unless for sex.

What I wish I had right now was a friend, about my age, who feels as deeply about things (and other people) as I do. Who isn't afraid to show it. Who isn't afraid to talk to about hard things, but whom I can also go out and do things with, be real with, have fun with, and feel like said friend desires and values me as a friend as much as I value him. I'll be honest, there are some hard things in my life, some that I haven't completely figured out yet. I wouldn't be on here posting that I need friends if that were not the case. But as I said, I also would love to have another man to just do things with. I like racquetball, ping pong, camping, hiking, volleyball, disc golf. I love conversation, and I don't avoid the difficult topics. But I find that I sit around entirely too much since I haven't found anyone to do any of that with. A little help on that front would be appreciated.

I should also say that I have deep convictions about a lot of things, religious, moral, political to name a few, and am not afraid to discuss those topics, as long as it stays respectful. But those convictions also are a way of life for me. I try my best to actually live according to my beliefs, though I often fail at it. On that note, I don't drink or smoke anything so meeting up for a drink or 420 isn't my thing.

If you likewise want such a friend, I may be your man. Just so you have a little more idea of who I am, I'm 29, from South Carolina, but live in Centennial now (near at least some places in Aurora). I am looking for friends around my age (say 20s to about 35 maybe). Not that I mind older people, I just feel I need a peer more than a mentor. I travel a lot for work, which sadly means I'm sometimes gone for a few days at a time, hence at least part of the hard time finding steady friendships in my life.

I probably am one of the more unusual men you'll ever meet. I guess a man who looks for other men in CL ads for anything other than sex is already a little weird, but hey, you're looking in the platonic section too, so let's be weird together. If you'd like to talk more or meet up, feel free to email back. We can start there.

title: Nerdy geeky friends?
text:
Hi lonely people, I'm pretty lonely myself. Please don't get me wrong, I have friends, great friends actually, they're just all men. I would like female friends up here in Colorado. 

I'm not your local Colorado mountain man, I'm from Arkansas and where I come from, there was jack shit to do. I enjoy sci-fi, video games, comics (I don't care about the marvel/DC battle), learning about random stuff, and just working on myself. I think I'm fun, just don't really know how to make friends of the opposite sex that can respect that I don't just want to fuck them. I'm not in a place to be in a relationship and I don't know about casual sex, that depends on the person. 

I'm also not an overweight basement dweller that lives with his parents. :p

So, the bad. I have a panic disorder and go to intensive therapy. It's sometimes difficult for me to bounce out and go exploring. Until I figure this out, I don't want to fall in love. I mean, yes, I do. I just can't financially support very much and will not let another potential partner just take care of me, that's not fair and I have ended relationships because I wasn't getting better. They deserved better. :/ It fucking sucks.

Now that the bad is out of the way, I think that I'm a sweet, supporting, positive person. I'm pretty sure that I'm funny and generally a great person, I write this because my friends are amazing and have never let me down and I do my best not to be a shit friend. 

I just read what I wrote, it sounds like an application, not very much emotion, sorry about that, it's hard to write with fiery passion. 

Anyways, wanna talk about anime, animals, space, aliens, music, metaphysical science, spooky ghosts, scary movies, video games, or just bullshit? Browse reddit or 9gag and share our amazing findings? If you have the dankest memes, please share. Hang out and binge watch something on Netflix? Get some crayons and coloring books and listen to each other's music? I'm down. 

Please don't murder me, I doubt it would be pleasant. I will haunt you for forever and be totally mean. Favorite mug? I'mma break it with my ghost powers after you pour your favorite drink. Want ghost shit all over your bed? No murder! 

Texting, emailing, phone calls, hanging out, yes.

I'm okay with sending pictures of myself and not a bot. 

If you're still reading, fuck yeah. Also, if I'm not what you're looking for, I hope you find some awesome friends.

title: Nice Guy trying to move to Denver area
text:
Hey!

I am ready for a change in my life, and I'm thinking about moving to the Denver area. Right now, I live in Kansas City, and I really want to live in a more liberal/progressive part of the country, and I have been to Denver enough to know that "in general" Denver and Colorado match my morals a lot more than Kansas City & either Kansas or Missouri.

About me: I am a single, 29 y/o straight man coming from a mixed family background (My mum is Catholic; My father is Jewish). I am an extremely polite, nice, kind, person. Politically, I am definitely left of center (If you are even contemplating voting for Trump you can disregard this message; we wouldn't get along!) I love sports, and would be really excited to live close to the Rapids & an NBA team in particular. 

Right now, I am working PT at a furniture/home goods store that has several branches in the Denver area, so between 1 of these stores it would be probably easy for me to get a few hours a week to just get started, but I am wanting to change my employment situation.

I am going to get certified to ref soccer in March here in KC, and this will transfer with me to Colorado so I can ref soccer matches. I have a college degree in Recreation & Tourism Management, and I previously worked for the Philadelphia Eagles so I would be interested in getting involved with the Rapids, Nuggets, or one of the sports arenas.

Lastly, I am 420 friendly. As a former basketball player who has had 3 major knee surgeries, I do believe in the medicinal benefits of it for pain/arthritis. Once a resident of Colorado, I would be interested in getting my Med Badge and pursuing work opportunities in the MMJ industry. I do NOT need to smoke inside (although it would be nice) but like I said, I am a smoker so living with people that at least are morally OK with this is probably necessary.

That's me! I am looking for people to live with! New friends! I might only be working PT at first, but I have the financial ability to pay several months in advance with a security deposit, and I really need a "home base" as I pursue all these options I discussed.

Thanks for taking the time to read this post, and if I sound like I might be a fit for your home, or you know of someone who might be, I'd love to hear from you! Even if this is a temporary 1-4 month thing while I get settled and then find a different more permanent place to live, this could work too!

KC is not that far from Denver (I've been to Denver and Colorado a lot) so if anyone is interested in meeting me face to face it is no problem for me to drive out and meet people!

Hope to hear from some nice people! :-D

Cheers.

I am looking for someone nearby who can help me with transportation to doctor appointments, to the hospital and back, errands, grocery shopping, light cooking, household chores and personal care until I get better. It would be nice if a friendship or friendships if you have interested friends, developed as I need to increase my social activities. I am educated BS/MS. I manage real estate property for a living. I own my own house and have a steady income. I am a friendly sociable guy with varied interests. I like to travel again when my back is fixed. I have found it impossible to date or do anything that involves exercise or standing in line because of my back. Otherwise in good health. I like movies and TV shows. I am handy at fixing things around the house. I like going out to eat at a variety of restaurants.

If this sounds interesting to you, please send me a reply and a phone number and we can meet and go from there. You can ask me anything by email, if you like.

Doug

title: Could you be out there?
text:
Unfortunately I have found myself at the end of a relationship. If you have been there, you know how that feels. I am trying to move on and keep trucking. 

About me: I am 33, (will be 34 in a couple weeks), average built, non smoker (of anything and you must be too), non drinker (an occasional drink or glass of wine here and there), d&d free and plan on keeping it that way. I am a disabled vet. I served in the Air Force as a Police Officer for 6 years as my first career path till I was medically discharged. Since then, after a few government security jobs, I learned Audio/Video and was an A/V Tech for a church for another 6 years. I also continue to do freelance work for a tv studio and other A/V installs occasionally. I have now returned back to school full time and I am in my first semester at MSU pursuing a degree for Computer Science. 
I do have 3 kids from my first wife, a daughter who is 16, and two boys that are 14 and 12. They live in Illinois and I get them out here for a month during the summers, other than that, I am all alone except for my dog. I do NOT want more kids of my own and have also taken precautions to make sure such things don't happen. If this is an issue and you think you may want one or more later on, then I'm not your guy, sorry. I am not opposed to the fact that you may have your own.
I love the outdoors. I love to go hiking in the mountains. I also have a Trailblazer that I have extremely modified for off roading and love to hit trails whenever possible and especially shooting. I love to fish or just go for walks on a nice calm evening. One of my biggest woo-saw's (stress reliever, for those that don't know what woo-saw is), is listening to Zac Brown Band on a quiet evening sitting at my fire pit. I love to laugh and make people laugh. I am more of the shy type at first unless I get to know you or am around friends and company I am comfortable with and love to be a clown and become the entertainment. 

What am I looking for: That's a good question, I thought I had what I always wanted but that turned out to not be the case. First off, if anything was to lead toward any kind of a relationship, you must be faithful and trustworthy. (Trust and faithfulness is a big deal to me and I will not compromise.) Someone that is close to my age, mature (but has a good sense of humor and a goofy side), non-smoker (this includes mj!), no drugs of any kind, non, or light social drinker, and preferably not a mouth your mother would be ashamed to listen too. Also, I am not into bbw's, I'm sorry, but big girls are just not my type. You don't have to be skinny, average or a little extra is perfectly ok, I am just not attracted to bigger girls. 

I am not looking to jump straight into a serious relationship with the words of marriage being flung out next month, but I would like to meet some nice friends and see where things go. If there is a connection and it leads to more, I would not be opposed to it at all. If all of this sounds like something you feel you could match up to and/or would like to know more about, please at least say hi and don't be shy. I would love to hear from you. Good luck out there.

please put "I read your post" in the subject line so I know you are real. Thanx

title: In Company of Extraordinary
text:
People are humans of habitual patterns. We do what we know is 
Comfortable. ItS not that we wish to be limited by our own boundaries that have
been conditioned 
Time and time again
Our mindset is that we are ordinary.
Why not be extrodinary? To the point
Where society would frown if our secrets came out?

We are a tight knit group 
Of 
those who have gone into hells abbyes and walked
Away with their heads still pointed to the stars
Of
Those who have walked the fine line of functionality and ruin
Of 
Those who just like blowing pretty clouds.

If your taste is pointed toward green to just hang out and lean about 
OR maybe some black to take you back? 
Blow to go some more or some crystal white to see the light. 
We accept you as who you are and wish to create a special bond with you and your partner/significant other. 
We want you to reaffirm that YOU, no matter your 
Delicate desires, are not alone.

If you send us a little about you , tell us a short bio
And what makes you extraordinary. 
We will respond in a timely manner and hopefully make a lasting relationship
Fulfilling the needs and wants of each other
You can come see me or I can come see you

Looking forward to seeing you soon.
God bless

title: It's not really about the diet and exercise
text:
Having been involved in athletics and personal training for 30+ years,
I've achieved a lot of my personal targets around athletics and my body.
I've been stuck on the couch and shifted back into movement all the while thinking I don't have the time to exercise or eat right.

I've learned what really created the shifts for me to be able to achieve these targets I had for myself. It isn't the work or effort I put into it, it wasn't forcing discipline or faking that having patience was fine. It was a shift in how I was choosing to think. How I think about the target itself and how I think about the journey vs the end goal.

I can show you this, build a plan for you around your exercise, nutrition and the mindfulness habits to support and get you to your targets!

Would you be interested in a complimentary 30 minute discovery session to see what is possible for you, and if we can build this plan together to achieve your targets?

There is no obligation to hire me, and you will walk away with at least one tool you can employ right now to help you!

Reply to this post, and let's get you started today!

title: Searching for more ease with your life?

Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

Touch one Bar and you begin to clear away the energy locked up in that area or aspect of your life just by touching it, clearing the space for new awareness to come in.

The creative possibilities for your life begin to open up!

It's been said that at worst a Bars session will feel like a great massage. At best, it will change your life!

Are you interested in seeing what a 60 or 90 minute Bars session can do for you?

title: Nerdy geeky friends?
text:
Hi lonely people, I'm pretty lonely myself. Please don't get me wrong, I have friends, great friends actually, they're just all men. I would like female friends up here in Colorado. 

I'm not your local Colorado mountain man, I'm from Arkansas and where I come from, there was jack shit to do. I enjoy sci-fi, video games, comics (I don't care about the marvel/DC battle), learning about random stuff, and just working on myself. I think I'm fun, just don't really know how to make friends of the opposite sex that can respect that I don't just want to fuck them. I'm not in a place to be in a relationship and I don't know about casual sex, that depends on the person. 

I'm also not an overweight basement dweller that lives with his parents. :p

So, the bad. I have a panic disorder and go to intensive therapy. It's sometimes difficult for me to bounce out and go exploring. Until I figure this out, I don't want to fall in love. I mean, yes, I do. I just can't financially support very much and will not let another potential partner just take care of me, that's not fair and I have ended relationships because I wasn't getting better. They deserved better. :/ It fucking sucks.

Now that the bad is out of the way, I think that I'm a sweet, supporting, positive person. I'm pretty sure that I'm funny and generally a great person, I write this because my friends are amazing and have never let me down and I do my best not to be a shit friend. 

I just read what I wrote, it sounds like an application, not very much emotion, sorry about that, it's hard to write with fiery passion. 

Anyways, wanna talk about anime, animals, space, aliens, music, metaphysical science, spooky ghosts, scary movies, video games, or just bullshit? Browse reddit or 9gag and share our amazing findings? If you have the dankest memes, please share. Hang out and binge watch something on Netflix? Get some crayons and coloring books and listen to each other's music? I'm down. 

Please don't murder me, I doubt it would be pleasant. I will haunt you for forever and be totally mean. Favorite mug? I'mma break it with my ghost powers after you pour your favorite drink. Want ghost shit all over your bed? No murder! 

Texting, emailing, phone calls, hanging out, yes.

I'm okay with sending pictures of myself and not a bot. 

If you're still reading, fuck yeah. Also, if I'm not what you're looking for, I hope you find some awesome friends.

title: Something totally different
text:
This is probably a very weird post coming from a guy, But here it goes.
I am looking for a woman that wants to sleep with me once in a while. Sounds like all the other posts so far, Read on!
I am not talking about sex, I am talking about curling up next to me and sleeping through the night next to each other. 
I was married for 12 years and slept next to my wife, when I wasn't travelling, every night! After My divorce I dated a wonderful woman who would sleep with me almost every weekend. and even after we stopped dating, we are friends and she would sleep with me once or twice a month. She recently got engaged and feels she can not come for "sleepovers" any more and I respect her wishes. 


Lets do some friend stuff, grab a beer, go out for a nice dinner or order in and watch a movie, tell each other life stories, get to know each other and at the end of the night cuddle up and get some rest.

If you think maybe you would like an arrangement like this, are on the west side, and want a nice warm man to wrap his arms around you in bed, let me know. I tend to like smaller women, but I am not ruling anything out.

I am well educated, well read, well traveled, great conversationalist and great cook.
If you want to know more please email me.

title: What are you afraid of?

title: Looking for time out of the house
text:
Hello,

I need to get out of the house more and so I'm looking for a standing weekly date to go out do stuff with. Digital socializing is fine and all except it's like eating soyrizo when you really want the big chorizo. So ideally maybe we start by emailing each other multi paragraph, intense, emails detailing our beliefs about the future of humanity as alien pets. Then we have a beer. Then we get into the heavy business: plays, cemeteries, art, bug inspecting, languid strolls. I will get to hear your stories. I will get to care about you. 

Me. I've got enough education to kill a small pony. I'm highly impractical, but generally responsible. I'm in an open marriage, but both my wife and my girlfriend are very busy people. I'm a dad so I typically spend my Friday nights folding laundry. I'm an ecology dork that likes art museums and restaurants over hiking 14ers. I'm a little strange, but in a good way. For some reason I tend to make better friends with women. It's always been that way. 

Okay, well I'm going to send this out into deep space and see what kind of life forms I find. FYI. This is not about sexting or cyber or anything like that. I'm mostly looking to end up with real time conversations in pleasant company. 

Talk to you later, hopefully.

keywords: amphisbaenia, defenestrate, gnomid, synecdoche, quincunx, siphonophorae, surd

title: Dont read this if your looking for a good guyfriend...................
text:
Greeting's! To whom it may concern, reading this at this ungodly hour 323am I am sitting here typing on the keys like a late night bar pianist. Where is my Juliet! ? La la la la la... right? No seriously, I thought I give it a nice crack and see what I could dredge up from the murky waters of the C.L abiss, I am sure we are looking for the same thing my dear, all that bla bla bla stuff I could go on and on about. I will cut to the chase and say yes.. the date sites suck, I haven't run into her at King Soopers in the produce section, lol.. and I don't do Bar's and Dog parks,,, or Libraries for that matter.

It would be so nice just to meet a nice like minded compatible something at this point, Hell a Rock for cryin out loud! or a damn socker ball named, ( Julia!) remember Tom Hanks movie.. lol.. I have heard of some success stories that stemmed from a C.L meet. Oh! a lil about me.. hum.. 6ft Quarter blk, Puerto rican, French, and Blackfoot Indian. Calm headed, happy, mentally sane and stable, STD Free, good hygiene, keeps a clean house, no pets, drinks very little, I have tried 420, its ok, love to go on walks, bike rides ( gota Mountain bike).. road trips, short ones, I paint acrylic on canvas, Ill hit a good Movie on occasion. Im a pretty good cook too. I am cool with pets, and well behaved kids. I have a hard time with Cigarette smokers.. I own my place, have a nice car, collecting retirement from the USMC, and have a good job. I love to live in the moment and assume a Optimistic ideaology on life in general. Laugh at myself, and stay in the positive lane. Yes we have all walked though the valley of death, and despair, bearing our battle scares, it makes us who we are today. As a Leo, and strong Alpha Male, I walk with the confident stride of a King, sipping my cup of humility realizing how fragile life is, and where I came from, Life is good, with the right attitude. Well, maybe I said enough now, and I should get off this horse, and run a hot bath?... Oh by the way, if your resonating with any of this.. hit me up.. ( Smile )....

title: Empty phone
text:
So... I'm gonna take a chance, roll the dice, maybe make a buddy.

My name is Reese, I'm a 24 year old transmasculine guy living currently in the Denver metro area. I identify as a transguy (ftm) and I'm looking for texting buddies, since I work a lot and currently in between housing. I'm not looking for hook ups, friends with benefits, or anything like that. If we wind up do clicking to meet in public (which has rarely happened, not because I enjoy being anonymous, I have social awkwardness that leads to social anxiety), please understand I will wind up being silent a lot of the times, as I'm very shy. Now that is out of the way, let me spill about my positive attributes...

I'm an aspiring chef (with a current title of dishwasher, but I have a lot of recipe ideas, just no real way for me to create them given my situation. I really enjoy watching the Food Network (Chopped especially), and when I can, the Create channel on basic cable. I'm partnered with an amazing guy who is very important to me. I love beer but I don't drink it to excess, in fact, I prefer cooking with it. I'm a bit of a geek as well, I am a major fanboy of Doctor Who, which I can quite passionately talk about if given half a chance. I do enjoy reading but however, I rarely find time to because of the chaos I have been thrusted in. I do write a bit, usually while listening to some form of music that inspires a scene in my head (Last of the Wilds by Nightwish has recently inspired something just not sure what yet as the scene has yet to be written).

What I'm looking for... well that is quite a mixed bag. I'm looking for someone who would understand that I am very... awkward in person, someone who would tolerate texting some random guy who is quirky yet generous, human but a mystery. I am mostly seeking some sort of companionship but from a distance. If you are that person, feel free to reply to this ad, however to weed out those pesky robots who phish for people to join their websites and such, I ask that in the subject line, you put your top beer and food combos (Beyond beer and pizza, or beer and burgers).

title: Garage Sales/Estate Sales/Thrift Stores +++
text:
Garage sale season is starting! Im looking for my new cute and petite female friend who likes to hit the sales on the weekends! If interested...read on...

I resell a lot of stuff on eBay, Craigslist, and at a couple booths I have at an antique mall. I buy all my merchandise at garage sales, thrift stores, storage unit auctions and estate sales. So...its not a "lets stop and have some breakfast" type of morning for me if there are a lot of sales. Ive got to get from one to the next as quickly as possible. After 10 or 11 the stops can get a little slower as most of the good resellable stuff is gone by then. 

A little about me... late 40s, white guy, considered attractive with a little extra around the middle. 

A little about you... 25 to 50, cute and petite, someone who can show up on time, maybe wanting to learn about reselling on eBay, positive attitude and fun to be around.

Email if interested.

Thanks!

I love being outdoors this time of year just as the days get a bit longer and the sun becomes a little warmer. My favorite day of the year is daylight savings when we get our extra hour of evening light. Love it!

I'm into indie rock/up beat/obscure types of music that give you goose bumps they're sooo good. I don't watch sports, or play video games, or smoke pot, or get super hammered any more but I have been known to bring a back pack full of beer on a hike or two. I used to like to tube Boulder creek quite a bit and think I'll be getting back up there this summer again. 
Also, my family has a super rad cabin just past boulder that I love to spend time at. No running water, or electricity, but it totally adds to the charm and there's a new mine I just discovered nearby.... I'm totally gonna (safely) spelunk it!
Also,
I love good food, and hitting up the Mayan or Esquire for a strange movie. Indian lunch buffets are awesome, hot springs rock, and estate sales are fun. I haven't been to the flea market in a couple years....I want to check out Eldorado Spgs. pool for the history of it and Bishops Castle for the sheer quirkiness! Definitely on my list.

If you're interested in getting to know a new partner in crime then shoot me a note! What do you do for fun?

Cheers!

title: Help me learn how to girl (on a budget!)
text:
Long story short, I was always one of those fat chicks who clearly didn't care enough about herself to put in any time or effort into her appearance. My mom was the same way and I have all male friends; I never really learned anything about how to dress, how to do hair, how to do makeup, etc. 

In the last year I've lost 80lbs and gone from obese to not. I currently weigh less than my lowest high school weight, and I'm wearing a pants size I haven't ever been able to wear.

I want to learn how to be more feminine. Dressing my body has always been about hiding it, now I'd like to learn how to put together cute outfits and accentuate my positive features. I've never worn makeup, so I watched some tutorials and bought some basic drugstore stuff. I still don't wear it because I worry a lot about looking like a clown. I don't have another woman around who would freely and honestly tell me where I could improve and it's making it very hard to judge how well I'm doing it. 

And the hair; I have 2+ feet of it that I don't know what to do with. I can french braid it, but usually it's just parted and pulled into a ponytail or nautilus bun because I just don't know how else to wear it. Everything I've tried from tutorials and such comes out looking wonky and I can't figure out why. 

I live a pretty frugal lifestyle and I'd like to try to learn these things on a budget. I tend to shop only at thrift stores and places like Ross, and I'll get occasional pieces from Target or wally world. My small makeup collection is mostly drugstore/low end. That doesn't mean I won't spend money when I believe it's worth it, but I'm highly interested in learning how a girly girl might shop sales or thrift stores. 

Other than that, I'm a married 26 year old with a humble occupation and no children. We have a place and cars and are otherwise stable and drama free. I recently discovered I'm really into nail polish and nail care (I'd love to do at-home manis or try different nail art techniques with someone, I have a lot of tools and supplies!) I play piano and violin poorly. When it warms up some, I'm hoping to start running with the C25K app. My husband and I spend our limited free time watching movies and Netflix (currently watching ST:DS9,) playing various PC games and (more recently) casually learning MtG. We are 420 friendly, but if you aren't I'm not pushy and don't mind being sober. I have a severe alcohol intolerance, so am unable to drink. 

I'm hoping to make friends with anyone in my general age range (trying to gauge how people my age dress and such) who are interested enough in clothes, makeup and/or hair to teach a stranger what they know. Let's get coffee and chat, maybe go shopping together sometime. Let's try out new and different things. If you even just want a text buddy that's ok too. 

Please put a favorite brand name in the subject line. Thanks much for reading.

title: It's not really about the diet and exercise

I've learned what really created the shifts for me to be able to achieve these targets I had for myself. It isn't the work or effort I put into it, it wasn't forcing discipline or faking that having patience was fine. It was a shift in how I was choosing to think. How I think about the target itself and how I think about the journey vs the end goal.

I can show you this, build a plan for you around your exercise, nutrition and the mindfulness habits to support and get you to your targets!

title: Now hiring: best friend
text:
I know Craigslist isn't the best place to meet people unless you're looking for serial killers, but I read through this section a lot so I figured I may as well post my own ad. Can't hurt, right? 

I met my best friend on here almost five years ago. Now we live really far away from each other and have sort of fallen apart recently. I miss the camaraderie that comes with being around someone who knows all your secrets - someone who knows you like the back of their own hand. I have some awesome friends, but they're all guys... and while I love them, it's nonetheless a lot of testosterone and none of them love the botanic gardens like I do. 

Anyway, I'm rambling. I'm 22, have my own place & car, and have two dogs and a cat. I love going out & doing things with my dogs - so if you have dogs, that'd be great! We go to Chatfield Dog Park a lot, or Elk Meadows in Evergreen when I have time. This summer I'd like to be outside a lot, so I hope you want to go hiking. 

I'm basically looking for someone who I can share everything with. Someone who's down for midnight drives to the mountains, concerts on a whim, all sorts of adventures, spontaneous road trips, sitting on the kitchen floor at three in the morning while we talk endlessly and do our nails. You know, that kind of clichÃ© friendship I'm sure we all crave. I don't party, drink, smoke or do other drugs, and I've never been to a club or a bar (not that there's anything wrong with those things, I'm just lame), so if you're similar in that regard, I think we'd get along super well. :) 

Hit me up if you'd like. Please, no guys. There's enough sausage in my life.

title: Sarcastic, active girlfriends wanted!
text:
Is it just me, or does it prove increasingly difficult to make friends as adult who aren't flaky and can commit to making plans ahead of time? As I get older I realize I don't have the time or energy to constantly be the only person in the relationship putting in effort when it comes to spending time together. Therefore, if you're interested in making a new friend that actually wants to do things and won't blow you off at the last minute, let's talk!

I've never been the type of person to maintain a large circle of friends, but I would love to meet some new ladies around my age who want to do more than just exchange emails or texts. One of the biggest reasons my husband and I moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so I want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. Don't get me wrong, we like watching movies and shows on Netflix as much as anybody, but if it's nice outside, I don't want to be inside all day. I live outside of Colorado Springs but I'm posting this in the Denver section in the hopes of meeting more like minded people, since I haven't had a ton of luck thus far. Maybe there are some women out there in Castle Rock or the southern suburbs who can relate.

I'm very sarcastic and stubborn, but I'm extremely loyal and I like to think I'm a pretty good friend to the few people in my life who seem to value our friendship as much as I do. I'm an honest person, and I have no time for BS. I'm looking for other women without kids, since I don't have any.

Other things about me:
- I am married but I'm not glued to my husband, which is why I'm posting this ad. Your status doesn't matter but if you are in a relationship/married maybe we can all get together at some point since it's nice to meet other couples too. 
- I have an awesome dog so if you like animals that's a plus. We adopted her over the summer and she loves trails, so she usually comes with us when we go hiking.
- I love hiking, am trying to get back into running and just enjoy being in a state that has a great climate for being outdoors pretty much all year round. I'm not the kind of person that's going to be camping in a tent or running marathons, but we do a lot of day hiking and I'm working myself back to running 5Ks since I like that distance. I like to be outside in the winter (I'm from the Northeast so the cold/snow don't bother me) but I'm not really into mountain sports. 
- I love baking, both for humans and my dog. Chances are if you have a dog and we ever go hiking together, I will bring your dog treats :)

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some women out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

title: Intelligent Black Female Seeks...
text:
A Little about me:
I am a black woman, 40 years old, 5'7", 150 pounds. I'm kinda girly--I paint my toenails and wear lip gloss for work and nice outings, but I also LOVE to put on a dingy T-shirt and raggedy baggy pants to hang out in the woods.

I love the outdoors scene--hiking, taking weekend road trips to places I've never been and camping is an ABSOLUTE MUST. I'd like to get my Jeep Wrangler (and German Shepherd puppies) this summer-- for now I have my car and my motorcycle to get me from point A to point B.

I have a few trips planned for this year: SCUBA diving in St. Lucia and Mexico--and if I could find a partner to road trip to the canyons in Arizona and the Carlsbad Caverns in New Mexico that would be awesome. 

I absolutely love to discuss ideas, meaning that I am interested in intelligent conversation about life, but I also love to do silly things like putting on nothing but an over-sized t-shirt, blasting my stereo and dancing to music that makes me love the fact that I'm alive. Sometimes, instead of taking bites out of a Snickers bar and eating it like a "normal" person, I shove the whole thing in my mouth 'cause somehow it seems to taste soooo much better that way. After reading that you may not believe this next thing, but I do have a professional job and I'm very much looking forward to advancing in my work. 

What I am looking for:
It is very hard to describe all that I am attracted to in an introductory post. I am hoping that by you reading a little about who I am, you will have a good idea if you and I would be a good fit -- but I'll give you a glimpse of what I'm looking for here...

Intellectually, I'm looking for someone whose values (honesty, integrity, courage, intellect, communication and much more!!) parallel mine; someone who's strong in areas that are not my strength so that I may learn from him; someone who wants to be my friend and who wants to get to know me before we go further. I'd like to meet someone who intellectually challenges me as well as his own ideas. Age is not necessarily important to me (although I really can't see myself dating someone in their 20's), but maturity level is.

It goes without saying that I would like to meet someone whose face and body I enjoy looking at, but there is no way for me to be able to tell if I enjoy looking until we meet. All I can say here is that I am mostly attracted to mature-acting men (race does not matter) who are much taller than I (again, I am 5'7).

On a personal note:
I am single, I do not have any children nor do I want any. That's not to say I am not interested in anyone with children, I'm just saying that I am not interested in having any of my own.

I'm sure there are many other things you'd like to know, so please feel free to write, telling me about yourself and asking any questions you want to know about me.
pets: None, but would love a couple dogs

title: Searching for more ease with your life?
text:
Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

Touch one Bar and you begin to clear away the energy locked up in that area or aspect of your life just by touching it, clearing the space for new awareness to come in.

The creative possibilities for your life begin to open up!

It's been said that at worst a Bars session will feel like a great massage. At best, it will change your life!

More questions? Check out this link:

http://access-consciousness-blog.com/2011/02/frequently-asked-questions-about-the-bars/

title: It's not really about the diet and exercise
text:
Having been involved in athletics and personal training for 30+ years,
I've achieved a lot of my personal targets around athletics and my body.
I've been stuck on the couch and shifted back into movement all the while thinking I don't have the time to exercise or eat right.

I've learned what really created the shifts for me to be able to achieve these targets I had for myself. It isn't the work or effort I put into it, it wasn't forcing discipline or faking that having patience was fine. It was a shift in how I was choosing to think. How I think about the target itself and how I think about the journey vs the end goal.

I can show you this, build a plan for you around your exercise, nutrition and the mindfulness habits to support and get you to your targets!

Would you be interested in a complimentary 30 minute discovery session to see what is possible for you, and if we can build this plan together to achieve your targets?

There is no obligation to hire me, and you will walk away with at least one tool you can employ right now to help you!

Reply to this post, and let's get you started today!

title: Just as well if you're from the island of misfit toys too...?
text:
If you're around my age & you're posting in the strictly platonic section or reading through post, then chances are you're experiencing the same difficulties I am. Being an adult & making new friends to substitute for the ones lost to marriages, children, & careers can be quite difficult sometimes. Therefore, if you're like me, you've resorted to utilizing the internet in hopes of discovering like-minded individuals with similar interest, passions, views, & beliefs as yourself to develop new friendships with, & enjoy fun & intriguing activities & events with. 

I'm a nerdy, abstract, melodic & obscure atypical CO native with a passion for intricate & melodic music, art, & design with a career in technical support & an affinity for shirt ties & a dapper flair, with indie, punk & alternative roots. It's that expression of music, art, & design that overflows into my surrounding & around my home. I'm charming & can contribute my witty humor, intelligence & vibrant demeanor to any fun conversations of substance, but still reveal a glimpse into my profane side. And I always appreciate different perspectives & stimulating thoughts. 

On any given night, I can be found on the Boulevards among the cityscapes of downtowns, traversing main streets & city parks, listening to the sounds of old guitars & live melodies, indulging in cultured interest (museums, galleries, the theatre, etc.), or sipping cocktails at a hole-in-the-wall. Otherwise, find me near a good heat source, unwinding at home with a glass of vino (or other adult concoction) & a good movie or book, or while sketching, painting & listening to jams.

Maybe we can go to a burlesque & comedy show at Lanny's Clock Tower; see a play or movie, go to an art gallery or museum, do karaoke or trivia night at a pub, or catch a band & some live music. I'm always down to things that are outside of the box as well. 

Sometimes my good qualities are overlooked by the fact that I have a disability. Everyone has imperfections & obstacle to overcome, it's one of mine. To the right people it never seems to be an imperfection at all though. So, if you're interested & think we'd get along, shoot me a response.

I am a strait man. m4w mw4mw m4m mw4ww
