title: A good person seeking a dating coach
text:
Hello,

I'm a 32 year guy who has had a weird last few years, taking me out of my element, and putting me in a position of being more introverted than my normal self (I can explain all of this in detail in person). As I come out of this period in my life, I'm finding my social skills to be a little rusty, and I want to find someone to talk to, especially about dating. I haven't had any problems with dating, per se, but I feel I'm not seeing the results I'd like to lately, and would love to get some outside perspective.

A little about me: I own a small business, very physically active, love gardening & cooking, and overall a caring, open, and passionate person. Additionally, I live in Boulder. The reason I'm posting in the Denver group is because it's more active than the Boulder group, and feel I'll find more diverse perspectives here. Meeting in Denver would be easiest for me, though I meet in other areas that are conveniently accessed with public transportation, or via bicycle. 

On a final note: I've been told I'm a very good listener, and this wouldn't be a one-way street. If you need to talk about anything in your life, I'd love to listen and help.

title: Long Distance Pen Pal
text:
I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Are you Stuck?
text:
Are you stuck?

What if working out and proper nutrition was more than just a Means to
lose weight and get into shape?

What if it was a catalyst to shifting your life?

In my years as a trainer I have noticed one amazing thing about
purposeful movement and good nutrition. It gives people to confidence
to do amazing things with their lives!

People step up into better engagement in their jobs, relationships, in their lives!
Of course a healthier body shows up along for the ride, but are you ready to really shift your life?

How about a complementary exploratory session to see what is possible?

Answer back to this ad, and let's talk!

---Greg

title: Are you a fun, active couple?
text:
I'm posting this ad in the hopes of finding some new couples to spend time with, who aren't flaky and have the ability to commit to making plans ahead of time without always canceling at the last minute! I'm sure if you're taking the time to read this ad, you probably have friends like this - the kind who always complain about how they're bored and want to do stuff, but as soon as you propose doing something they're "busy" or "can't go." As you get older you realize you don't have the time or energy to constantly be the only side of the relationship putting in effort when it comes to spending time together. Therefore, if you are also a couple that wants to make new friends that are actually up for DOING things, let's talk! My husband and I live outside of Colorado Springs, but coming from the East Coast where it takes an hour to drive 15 miles on most days, driving doesn't bother either of us. Plus I figure that everyone here drives into the mountains throughout the year, so what's the difference in a one hour drive between the Springs and Denver suburbs if you have friends you want to spend time with?

One of the biggest reasons we moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so we want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. We try to go hiking every weekend (though it's more low key now that it's colder), and I have a whole list of places I want to go in/around Colorado Springs and the rest of the state. Last summer we did a lot of hiking up off 70, climbed Quandary Peak and made our way out towards Aspen. We want to get down to the Sand Dunes and spend some time in Crested Butte this summer to see the wildflowers.

We have an awesome dog so if you like animals that's a plus. We adopted her over the summer and she loves trails, so she usually comes with us when we go hiking - unless of course it's somewhere dogs aren't allowed, we don't just bring her to be tools. Finding a couple with a dog that also wants to get out and explore would be great, but you don't have to have a dog as long as you don't hate them or something. 

My husband loves football, video/computer games (what dude doesn't?) and is in the process of getting his Masters degree. We both have hard science degrees, love to travel and do not smoke (anything). We don't have kids, and are looking for people in the same boat. 

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some people out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

title: Spun People's = Fun People's
text:
It takes all kinds of people to make the world go 'round. 
And we are a couple that chose to embrace those that 
are a little different, who's ideas of a good time venture 
outside the normal parameters set by society, and we are
seeking out those that are like us in this aspect.

Male, female, couples, it doesn't matter! Good people
are good people no matter what, and that's what we are 
looking for. Good, honest, down to earth people who 
still have morals and place value on being decent.

Dinner, movie night, drinks, game night,hot tub-ing, 
parties, day trips to try something new, or just sitting 
around smoking a bowl and hanging out. It doesn't 
have to be crazy, and it doesn't have to be super mellow.
As long as we have good people around us that's what 
matters, that's what makes or breaks the experiences.....

Weather you like the green to slow down and mellow out,
the clear to get spun and go fast, or the white to just 
go a little crazy for the night, we don't care, and we don't judge.
We believe that everything is good in moderation, everything 
can be used to enhance your experience and your life. 

Send us a message, tell us a little about yourself,
your interests and your dislikes, tell us about the things
that make you, well you. We will respond to you, and if it seems
that this could be a friendship that enhances all our lives, we 
can progress like we should. 

We are NOT looking for hook ups ( though we can always hook you
up with your favorite party favors) We are NOT looking for pnp 
(although we are not opposed to it either. We are of a "what happens
is what happens" mindset.) We truly are just looking to add some
more good people to our lives, and we can't wait to meet you!!!!

title: Spring Activities? I'm 34, Fun, Athletic, Redundant, and Fun!
text:
Hi, 
I'm looking for fun people to hike, bike, explore, and adventure with as the weather warms up.
As the title says, I'm 34 years old and I love to eat healthy and push on heavy things at 24 hour fitness. I'm a native and spring is my favorite season as I really don't like winter too much. I love being outdoors this time of year just as the days get a bit longer and the sun becomes a little warmer. My favorite day of the year is daylight savings when we get our extra hour of evening light. Love it!

I'm into indie rock/up beat/obscure types of music that give you goose bumps they're sooo good. I don't watch sports, or play video games, or smoke pot, or get super hammered any more but I have been known to bring a back pack full of beer on a hike or two. I used to like to tube Boulder creek quite a bit and think I'll be getting back up there this summer again. 
Also, my family has a super rad cabin just past boulder that I love to spend time at. No running water, or electricity, but it totally adds to the charm and there's a new mine I just discovered nearby.... I'm totally gonna (safely) spelunk it!
Also,
I love good food, and hitting up the Mayan or Esquire for a strange movie. Indian lunch buffets are awesome, hot springs rock, and estate sales are fun. I haven't been to the flea market in a couple years....I want to check out Eldorado Spgs. pool for the history of it and Bishops Castle for the sheer quirkiness! Definitely on my list.

If you're interested in getting to know a new partner in crime then shoot me a note! What do you do for fun?

Cheers!

title: Help me learn how to girl (on a budget!)
text:
Long story short, I was always one of those fat chicks who clearly didn't care enough about herself to put in any time or effort into her appearance. My mom was the same way and I have all male friends; I never really learned anything about how to dress, how to do hair, how to do makeup, etc. 

In the last year I've lost 80lbs and gone from obese to not. I currently weigh less than my lowest high school weight, and I'm wearing a pants size I haven't ever been able to wear.

I want to learn how to be more feminine. Dressing my body has always been about hiding it, now I'd like to learn how to put together cute outfits and accentuate my positive features. I've never worn makeup, so I watched some tutorials and bought some basic drugstore stuff. I still don't wear it because I worry a lot about looking like a clown. I don't have another woman around who would freely and honestly tell me where I could improve and it's making it very hard to judge how well I'm doing it. 

And the hair; I have 2+ feet of it that I don't know what to do with. I can french braid it, but usually it's just parted and pulled into a ponytail or nautilus bun because I just don't know how else to wear it. Everything I've tried from tutorials and such comes out looking wonky and I can't figure out why. 

I live a pretty frugal lifestyle and I'd like to try to learn these things on a budget. I tend to shop only at thrift stores and places like Ross, and I'll get occasional pieces from Target or wally world. My small makeup collection is mostly drugstore/low end. That doesn't mean I won't spend money when I believe it's worth it, but I'm highly interested in learning how a girly girl might shop sales or thrift stores. 

Other than that, I'm a married 26 year old with a humble occupation and no children. We have a place and cars and are otherwise stable and drama free. I recently discovered I'm really into nail polish and nail care (I'd love to do at-home manis or try different nail art techniques with someone, I have a lot of tools and supplies!) I play piano and violin poorly. When it warms up some, I'm hoping to start running with the C25K app. My husband and I spend our limited free time watching movies and Netflix (currently watching ST:DS9,) playing various PC games and (more recently) casually learning MtG. We are 420 friendly, but if you aren't I'm not pushy and don't mind being sober. I have a severe alcohol intolerance, so am unable to drink. 

I'm hoping to make friends with anyone in my general age range (trying to gauge how people my age dress and such) who are interested enough in clothes, makeup and/or hair to teach a stranger what they know. Let's get coffee and chat, maybe go shopping together sometime. Let's try out new and different things. If you even just want a text buddy that's ok too. 

Please put a favorite brand name in the subject line. Thanks much for reading.

title: In need of friends and temporary home care
text:
I am a good looking senior with no friends or family locally. I live alone and am going to have back surgery in a month or so. I will not be able to drive and take care of myself for a few weeks. My immediate need is to find someone to take me to and from a couple outpatient procedures. The clinic will not let me drive home or be released to a taxicab.

I am looking for someone nearby who can help me with transportation to doctor appointments, to the hospital and back, errands, grocery shopping, light cooking, normal household chores and personal care until I get better. Any age range is OK as long as you can help me get to a standing position from a seated or lying down position and back again. I am willing to pay the going rate. At first it may be 24 hr per day until I see how independent I am. You may not have to be here if you live nearby and I can call you. I can supply references so you know who I am and can be trusted. I don't anticipate any medical needs other than pain meds.

Since I have no local friends, I am also looking to make some.

It would be nice if a friendship or friendships if you have interested friends, developed as I need to increase my social activities. I am educated BS/MS. I manage real estate property for a living. I own my own house and have a steady income. I am a friendly sociable guy with varied interests. I like to travel again when my back is fixed. I have found it impossible to date or do anything that involves exercise or standing in line because of my back. Otherwise in good health. I like movies and TV shows. I am handy at fixing things around the house. I like going out to eat at a variety of restaurants.

If this sounds interesting to you, please send me a reply and a phone number and we can meet and go from there. You can ask me anything by email, if you like.
Thanks,
Doug

title: Agoraphobia
text:
Hi. My name is Kalia, I'm 23, and I have agoraphobia.

What that means, practically, is that I have a hard time leaving my home. It makes it pretty difficult to meet people, as you can probably guess.

Commonly asked questions: No, I don't work. Yes, I get my groceries delivered. No, staying at home is not "relaxing and fun". Yes, it's very lonely. No, I didn't make a decision to live this way, I have a condition that requires it. Yes, I'm working very hard towards my recovery.

I'm looking for a friend. Someone who will like me and spend time with me in spite of my limitations. I have trouble leaving my home, but otherwise I'm a normal person. I like action movies and comedy specials. I'm a huge nerd. I love comic books and superheroes, as well as magic and fantasy. I play a lot of video games, especially RPGs like Skyrim and Fallout. I read fanfiction. I'm into Game of Thrones and Harry Potter, Arrow and The Flash. My favorite cartoon is Steven Universe.

I want to meet someone who will bring over blankets and pillows for a movie marathon, or help me try a new recipe for the first time, or go for long walks around the neighborhood.

I have a lot of free time on my hands, and I'd like to spend some of it with a new friend.

Please put your favorite color in the subject line!

title: Nice Guy trying to move to Denver area
text:
Hey!

I am ready for a change in my life, and I'm thinking about moving to the Denver area. Right now, I live in Kansas City, and I really want to live in a more liberal/progressive part of the country, and I have been to Denver enough to know that "in general" Denver and Colorado match my morals a lot more than Kansas City & either Kansas or Missouri.

About me: I am a single, 29 y/o straight man coming from a mixed family background (My mum is Catholic; My father is Jewish). I am an extremely polite, nice, kind, person. Politically, I am definitely left of center (If you are even contemplating voting for Trump you can disregard this message; we wouldn't get along!) I love sports, and would be really excited to live close to the Rapids & an NBA team in particular. 

Right now, I am working PT at a furniture/home goods store that has several branches in the Denver area, so between 1 of these stores it would be probably easy for me to get a few hours a week to just get started, but I am wanting to change my employment situation.

I am going to get certified to ref soccer in March here in KC, and this will transfer with me to Colorado so I can ref soccer matches. I have a college degree in Recreation & Tourism Management, and I previously worked for the Philadelphia Eagles so I would be interested in getting involved with the Rapids, Nuggets, or one of the sports arenas.

Lastly, I am 420 friendly. As a former basketball player who has had 3 major knee surgeries, I do believe in the medicinal benefits of it for pain/arthritis. Once a resident of Colorado, I would be interested in getting my Med Badge and pursuing work opportunities in the MMJ industry. I do NOT need to smoke inside (although it would be nice) but like I said, I am a smoker so living with people that at least are morally OK with this is probably necessary.

That's me! I am looking for people to live with! New friends! I might only be working PT at first, but I have the financial ability to pay several months in advance with a security deposit, and I really need a "home base" as I pursue all these options I discussed.

Thanks for taking the time to read this post, and if I sound like I might be a fit for your home, or you know of someone who might be, I'd love to hear from you! Even if this is a temporary 1-4 month thing while I get settled and then find a different more permanent place to live, this could work too!

KC is not that far from Denver (I've been to Denver and Colorado a lot) so if anyone is interested in meeting me face to face it is no problem for me to drive out and meet people!

Hope to hear from some nice people! :-D

Cheers.

In the past I had contemplated posting something like this several times. I don't know what's actually pushing me to finally do it but here I am.

I'm sure my story is no different than many others. A man gets married and after several years of marriage he finds himself neglected, alone. I think perhaps the difference in my case is the amount of effort I've put into that marriage to see some sort of change. I've tried for years. I've took every piece of advice given to me by professionals and yet I still found myself ignored and often times feeling as though I was taken forgranted. At this point, newly single, I just need a fun and passionate connection. Someone I can share with, vent to, laugh with, and enjoy.

Just as my description says I'm an attractive man, 30, 6 foot, and take good care of myself. I would like to connect with a woman who is in a similar situation, someone as equally frustrated and just wants some fun. Beyond the connection I'm not sure what else I'm looking for but I'm sure that if there is a deep connection we can figure that out.

Yes I'm very real. It's a nice day out. I've no idea what kind of interesting replies this posting will receive, if any, but I'm excited for the chance that there just might be someone out there who feels the way I do and is ready to build a connection.

title: Where are the fun, active couples?
text:
I'm posting this ad in the hopes of finding some new couples to spend time with, who aren't flaky and have the ability to commit to making plans ahead of time. I'm sure if you're taking the time to read this ad, you probably have friends like this - the kind who always complain about how they're bored and want to do stuff, but as soon as you propose doing something you get radio silence. Therefore, if you are also a couple that wants to make new friends that are actually up for DOING things, let's talk! I'm posting this in the Denver section because even though we live outside of Colorado Springs, coming from the East Coast where it takes an hour to drive 15 miles on most days, driving doesn't bother either of us. We just drove an hour to go to a hiking trail in Woodland Park last weekend, so if you live in Castle Rock or the south suburbs, we aren't all that far apart.

One of the biggest reasons we moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so we want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. We're not going camping in the woods for days at a time or anything but when it's nice out, we are not sitting inside all day. Basically, it would be great to find other couples who are interested in stuff like having a backyard BBQ or taking a longer drive to a nice hiking spot to get away from the more popular places. We have an awesome dog so she usually comes with us when we go hiking. Finding a couple with a dog that also wants to get out and explore would be great, but you don't have to have a dog as long as you don't hate them or something. 

My husband loves football, video/computer games (what dude doesn't?) and is in the process of getting his Masters degree. We both have hard science degrees, love to travel and do not smoke anything so we aren't looking for smoking buddies. We don't have kids, and are looking for people in the same boat. 

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some people out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

title: Sarcastic, active girlfriends wanted!
text:
Is it just me, or does it prove increasingly difficult to make friends as adult who aren't flaky and can commit to making plans ahead of time? As I get older I realize I don't have the time or energy to constantly be the only person in the relationship putting in effort when it comes to spending time together. Therefore, if you're interested in making a new friend that actually wants to do things and won't blow you off at the last minute, let's talk!

I've never been the type of person to maintain a large circle of friends, but I would love to meet some new ladies around my age who want to do more than just exchange emails or texts. One of the biggest reasons my husband and I moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so I want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. Don't get me wrong, we like watching movies and shows on Netflix as much as anybody, but if it's nice outside, I don't want to be inside all day. I live outside of Colorado Springs but I'm posting this in the Denver section in the hopes of meeting more like minded people, since I haven't had a ton of luck thus far. Maybe there are some women out there in Castle Rock or the southern suburbs who can relate.

I'm very sarcastic and stubborn, but I'm extremely loyal and I like to think I'm a pretty good friend to the few people in my life who seem to value our friendship as much as I do. I'm an honest person, and I have no time for BS. I'm looking for other women without kids, since I don't have any.

Other things about me:
- I am married but I'm not glued to my husband, which is why I'm posting this ad. Your status doesn't matter but if you are in a relationship/married maybe we can all get together at some point since it's nice to meet other couples too. 
- I have an awesome dog so if you like animals that's a plus. We adopted her over the summer and she loves trails, so she usually comes with us when we go hiking.
- I love hiking, am trying to get back into running and just enjoy being in a state that has a great climate for being outdoors pretty much all year round. I'm not the kind of person that's going to be camping in a tent or running marathons, but we do a lot of day hiking and I'm working myself back to running 5Ks since I like that distance. I like to be outside in the winter (I'm from the Northeast so the cold/snow don't bother me) but I'm not really into mountain sports. 
- I love baking, both for humans and my dog. Chances are if you have a dog and we ever go hiking together, I will bring your dog treats :)

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some women out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

title: Church buddy for Saturday nights
text:
Hello!

I'll spare you the long version of my story -- until you ask -- but let's just say that for reasons related to my marriage and my divorce, I find myself nearly completely disconnected from the world. I also find my faith waning. I have a couple of good guy friends, but they're married and otherwise occupied most of the time.

I don't really know why I am searching for a woman to buddy up with me for church friend-dates on Saturday. I CAN promise you that I am NOT interested in a physical or romantic relationship. I want a real friend, like I haven't had since I was about twenty-one. I miss sitting in front of one other person, sharing all my bull-s%&t and not being judged. I miss causing myself shame (not really) but having a friend to sit across from me, listen to my story, and share an empathetic look with me. I guess I want a real friend, maybe a bff if we really hit it off.

About me: I'm a 36-year-old divorced father of two who is not looking for romance or intimate connection right now; getting back into the world of the living is where I want to start. I used to play soccer (and would like to still) and wrestle, and I love writing. I have started and gotten fifteen to twenty pages in on about fifty books over the course of my life. I am also a teacher, although I am currently questioning that path. I love to have fun, but I am a hurting soul and am both a little awkward and a little uptight at times. I want to find that happy spark again, and I think having friends, paired with the joy of my children, is the ticket.

Let me know if you live on the west side of town (Arvada, Wheatridge, Littleton, Lakewood, Golden, etc.) and would like to spend part of Saturday evenings worshiping God.

Cheers!

title: Looking for a good friend
text:
Re-posting this.

Hi my name is Adam. Since this is a CL personal's ad, let me first be clear on one point: I am NOT on here looking for sex. Not now, not down the road once you know me better. If that's what you think friendship is, well there are (and unfortunately from my viewpoint) a lot of posts from people who agree with you. Try them.

Now that that is out of the way, let me tell you a little of who I am and why I AM posting on here. It will be the first time I've done so. I'm posting on here because I believe the world we live in makes deep and intimate human connection difficult and therefore hard to come by, at least for me. Honestly, I don't know how to build a real friendship when for many people, the occasional "like" on Facebook or "LOL" text message constitutes friendship. That and all the rules that forbid men from getting close to one another physically, emotionally, spiritually, or any other _ally unless they are into homosexuality. Sorry, but I reject both the notions of superficial non-connected friendships as well as the opposite that "real men" only interact in fist bumps and bro-hugs and don't actually have any kind of feelings or need for anyone but themselves unless for sex.

What I wish I had right now was a friend, about my age, who feels as deeply about things (and other people) as I do. Who isn't afraid to show it. Who isn't afraid to talk to about hard things, but whom I can also go out and do things with, be real with, have fun with, and feel like said friend desires and values me as a friend as much as I value him. I'll be honest, there are some hard things in my life, some that I haven't completely figured out yet. I wouldn't be on here posting that I need friends if that were not the case. But as I said, I also would love to have another man to just do things with. I like racquetball, ping pong, camping, hiking, volleyball, disc golf. I love conversation, and I don't avoid the difficult topics. But I find that I sit around entirely too much since I haven't found anyone to do any of that with. A little help on that front would be appreciated.

I should also say that I have deep convictions about a lot of things, religious, moral, political to name a few, and am not afraid to discuss those topics, as long as it stays respectful. But those convictions also are a way of life for me. I try my best to actually live according to my beliefs, though I often fail at it. On that note, I don't drink or smoke anything so meeting up for a drink or 420 isn't my thing.

If you likewise want such a friend, I may be your man. Just so you have a little more idea of who I am, I'm 29, from South Carolina, but live in Centennial now (near at least some places in Aurora). I am looking for friends around my age (say 20s to about 35 maybe). Not that I mind older people, I just feel I need a peer more than a mentor. I travel a lot for work, which sadly means I'm sometimes gone for a few days at a time, hence at least part of the hard time finding steady friendships in my life.

I probably am one of the more unusual men you'll ever meet. I guess a man who looks for other men in CL ads for anything other than sex is already a little weird, but hey, you're looking in the platonic section too, so let's be weird together. If you'd like to talk more or meet up, feel free to email back. We can start there.

title: I'm all ears
text:
Hi there,

It's disingenuous to go on as if there's no romantic hopes wrapped up in this. Since I am really too busy those hopes are being deferred in favor of something more tangible. I just want interesting email and for some reason I communicate better with women. So, what's on your mind?

A little about me: I'm married with two small children. Me and my wife are in an open relationship so talking to me will not produce drama. In fact if we ever start meeting in person you'll even meet her. I'm hispanic, 5'10", reliably male, look like I like to eat (but I did lose 30lbs this year, yay me!), and really good with oak tree identification. I'm well educated (master's in soil ecology), well traveled (4 continents, 14 countries, 49 states), and impractical. I'm an odd bird and open-minded. There's very little you can say that will surprise me. I'm happy and I think my life is pretty awesome. 

Some people are confused by my vocabulary so I'll simplify this message. I want to email women. No pictures. No sexting. G-rated conversation. I would like to find a girlfriend someday, but I'm too busy to actively look. If you send me pictures, flirt, and go on as if you're interested in dating me then I may ask you out. If you don't then I will assume you just want someone to talk to. I'm all ears and promise I won't go all 'tear in my beer' on you.

title: Now hiring: best friend
text:
I know Craigslist isn't the best place to meet people unless you're looking for serial killers, but I read through this section a lot so I figured I may as well post my own ad. Can't hurt, right? 

I met my best friend on here almost five years ago. Now we live really far away from each other and have sort of fallen apart recently. I miss the camaraderie that comes with being around someone who knows all your secrets - someone who knows you like the back of their own hand. I have some awesome friends, but they're all guys... and while I love them, it's nonetheless a lot of testosterone and none of them love the botanic gardens like I do. 

Anyway, I'm rambling. I'm 22, have my own place & car, and have two dogs and a cat. I love going out & doing things with my dogs - so if you have dogs, that'd be great! We go to Chatfield Dog Park a lot, or Elk Meadows in Evergreen when I have time. This summer I'd like to be outside a lot, so I hope you want to go hiking. 

I'm basically looking for someone who I can share everything with. Someone who's down for midnight drives to the mountains, concerts on a whim, all sorts of adventures, spontaneous road trips, sitting on the kitchen floor at three in the morning while we talk endlessly and do our nails. You know, that kind of clichÃ© friendship I'm sure we all crave. I don't party, drink, smoke or do other drugs, and I've never been to a club or a bar (not that there's anything wrong with those things, I'm just lame), so if you're similar in that regard, I think we'd get along super well. :) 

Hit me up if you'd like. Please, no guys. There's enough sausage in my life.

title: Intelligent Black Female Seeks...
text:
A Little about me:
I am a black woman, 40 years old, 5'7", 150 pounds. I'm kinda girly--I paint my toenails and wear lip gloss for work and nice outings, but I also LOVE to put on a dingy T-shirt and raggedy baggy pants to hang out in the woods.

I love the outdoors scene--hiking, taking weekend road trips to places I've never been and camping is an ABSOLUTE MUST. I'd like to get my Jeep Wrangler (and German Shepherd puppies) this summer-- for now I have my car and my motorcycle to get me from point A to point B.

I have a few trips planned for this year: SCUBA diving in St. Lucia and Mexico--and if I could find a partner to road trip to the canyons in Arizona and the Carlsbad Caverns in New Mexico that would be awesome. 

I absolutely love to discuss ideas, meaning that I am interested in intelligent conversation about life, but I also love to do silly things like putting on nothing but an over-sized t-shirt, blasting my stereo and dancing to music that makes me love the fact that I'm alive. Sometimes, instead of taking bites out of a Snickers bar and eating it like a "normal" person, I shove the whole thing in my mouth 'cause somehow it seems to taste soooo much better that way. After reading that you may not believe this next thing, but I do have a professional job and I'm very much looking forward to advancing in my work. 

What I am looking for:
It is very hard to describe all that I am attracted to in an introductory post. I am hoping that by you reading a little about who I am, you will have a good idea if you and I would be a good fit -- but I'll give you a glimpse of what I'm looking for here...

Intellectually, I'm looking for someone whose values (honesty, integrity, courage, intellect, communication and much more!!) parallel mine; someone who's strong in areas that are not my strength so that I may learn from him; someone who wants to be my friend and who wants to get to know me before we go further. I'd like to meet someone who intellectually challenges me as well as his own ideas. Age is not necessarily important to me (although I really can't see myself dating someone in their 20's), but maturity level is.

It goes without saying that I would like to meet someone whose face and body I enjoy looking at, but there is no way for me to be able to tell if I enjoy looking until we meet. All I can say here is that I am mostly attracted to mature-acting men (race does not matter) who are much taller than I (again, I am 5'7).

On a personal note:
I am single, I do not have any children nor do I want any. That's not to say I am not interested in anyone with children, I'm just saying that I am not interested in having any of my own.

I'm sure there are many other things you'd like to know, so please feel free to write, telling me about yourself and asking any questions you want to know about me.

title: Long Distance Pen Pal
text:
I'll try my best to describe what I'd like, but I think the right person will understand. First of all, I"m not looking to meet. Where I am is not particularly relevant, but let's just say it's way too far for a meeting, even if I was interested. Basically, I'm looking for conversations that are outside our daily lives, the stuff you wouldn't normally voice out loud. This encompasses so many things, which I'm not going to list, but let's just say I speak my mind, No topic is off limits or "too soon" if it's funny. 

For the most part, I miss laughing. I had an on-line friend for about two years, and we used to have a lot of these weird conversations- and about our daily lives too- but I mostly miss those random, uninhibited thoughts that showed me who he really was. That's my take on it anyway- most of what we show the world on a daily basis is the version of "us" that is socially acceptable. I'd like to find someone who accepts me even if it doesn't always sound safe or sane. I'd like to do the same for you.

If you think this is for you, please feel free to introduce yourself, and include the same stats I've listed about myself in this ad. Oh, two things: 1) Please be a decent writer, who will write more than two sentences of "text speak". I will not respond to one- two line emails, or retarded questions like "Are you real?"; 2) Please have time to write more than once in a blue moon. I think once a day is reasonable, given all the responsibilities we have at home and work. It could be more on some days, but if you expect frequent emails every day, I'm not the one.

Finally, please don't be offended if I don't respond. It's not personal, it's Craigslist. In any case, thank you for taking the time to read my ad.

title: Mostly Strictly Platonic
text:
Well, maybe not STRICTLY platonic (but we'll start there). No reasonable person worth meeting EVER posts or looks in the "let's go have sex" categories, I know this is true! :)

Seeking an attractive, fit, and interesting woman, age 40-60 who is also looking for friendship, and occasionally getting together for a walk, a talk, a lunch, a croissant & Espresso, a bike ride, a couple hours out listening to live music. Casual romance is a possibility, but absolutely NOT a requirement or expectation. You do not have to be in a relationship, but it will probably be easier that way, so we have the same limitations and both have a strong motivation towards discretion. Again, this would be casual, no expectations, I am not looking for someone who wants to get serious, but I do like the idea of a long-term friendship, if we develop that kind of connection. 

I am smart, fit, nice looking (I look young for my age, and I take care of myself), artistic, and a good listener and talker. I have a very flexible schedule, live in central Denver, love to walk and bike, and love an excuse to go out to some of these new great restaurants Denver keeps getting. I like dogs. I have a dry sense of humor, and lots of passion. Lots.

I prefer a non-smoker, open-minded, who is "conscious-but-not-self-conscious", who can talk about spiritual & philosophical things and even religion or politics without getting crazy. Self confidence, a zest for living and lots of interests. 

Yes, this is a long shot.... but you just never know! Strange & wonderful things happen every day.

title: So much to talk about
text: Hi. I'm looking for a new friend. Yes, a platonic email pen pal -- but that sad little phrase makes it seem way too basic and clichÃ©. It's really much more than that. Anything physical is off the table (and to be honest I don't really feel obligated to explain why right now). But who I am interested in connecting with, is the woman in the Starbucks line who took extra time that morning to dress nice, put on those boots she feels pretty and confident in, but then sighs and wonders why she bothered. Or the one who sits in the tub at night, drinking wine out of a coffee cup, who just finished sorting out all the kid runs for tomorrow, and the homework that's due, and amid the smell of lavender and make-up remover takes fifteen minutes to secretly hate the guts of her female unmarried friend who took that exotic vacation, and callously posted the pics on Facebook. We're not bitter people at our core, but we've battled through enough where some days a good ear to listen, a nap and a little agenda-less flirting sounds amazing. I'm actually a clean-cut, happy, hopeful and kind guy, non smoker, no drugs, no tattoos. I'm an attentive listener, I think I'm hilarious anyway. I'm basically just a dreamer/romantic who needs somewhere or someone for my musings and flirty words to land on. Maybe we can help each other. Talk with you soon, Scott

title: Do you understand sarcasm and enjoy being active?
text:
I'm posting this ad in the hopes of finding some new couples to spend time with, who aren't flaky and have the ability to commit to making plans ahead of time. I'm sure if you're taking the time to read this ad, you probably have friends like this - the kind who always complain about how they're bored and want to do stuff, but as soon as you propose doing something you get radio silence. Therefore, if you are also a couple that wants to make new friends that are actually up for DOING things, let's talk! I'm posting this in the Denver section because even though we live outside of Colorado Springs, coming from the East Coast where it takes an hour to drive 15 miles on most days, driving doesn't bother either of us. If you live in Castle Rock or the south suburbs, we aren't all that far apart.

One of the biggest reasons we moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so we want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. We're not going camping in the woods for days at a time or anything but when it's nice out, we are not sitting inside all day. Basically, it would be great to find other couples who are interested in stuff like having a backyard BBQ or taking a longer drive to a nice hiking spot to get away from the more popular places. We have an awesome dog so she usually comes with us when we go hiking. Finding a couple with a dog that also wants to get out and explore would be great, but you don't have to have a dog as long as you don't hate them or something. 

My husband loves football, video/computer games (what dude doesn't?) and is in the process of getting his Masters degree. We both have hard science degrees, love to travel and do not smoke anything so we aren't looking for smoking buddies. We don't have kids, and are looking for people in the same boat. 

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some people out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

title: Getting friends off the internet?
text:
Hi,

My wife told me the other day, "You need more friends". She's right. Trouble is that I'm an odd bird so it's not exactly easy to find someone I connect with. I tend to make friends with women, but work in a nearly all male work place. Add to that I'm not great with small talk. How you get me to converse is by talking about something intense and substantive. Only after that do we get to the small things. I don't follow or sports or TV so I don't have much to talk about with most of humanity. 

And I'm fine with that, except sometimes it's a problem. Like when I want to get a beer and there's no one to do that with. Or when I want some company to help me with a project and there's no one to do that with. Or I want to hear an outside perspective and there's no one to tell me theirs. Everyone needs more than just one person. 

So here I am, quixotically trying to make friends on the internet. I'm not attempting a clandestine affair either. My wife knows about my goings on and is fine with me talking to other women. If it gets to the point where we go out for a beer you'll meet her most likely. 

So maybe you have similar ideas about fun. Fun for me is having a great conversation. You know one of those conversations that make you grow brain cells, not just because you may have learned something new, but because you've seen how to connect the dots differently. Fun for me is a long evening stroll, a game of trivial pursuit, or going out to eat interesting food. Fun for me is also geeking out about plants or animals, but I don't expect anyone else to share that. 

The point of this posting is to find someone to hang out with in real life. I like this whole world of electronic communication, and really like giving and getting email candy, but it's like snacking when you really need a meal. So be warned. After a few emails I'll probably ask you out (2nd warning. I write ridiculously long emails). Anyway, just putting this out into the universe and seeing what happens. 

Â¡Contactame Ya!

title: reply: please pray for me
text:
Dear,

Guy that's considering suicide. 

I just caught your post. I don't normally post here much and I would have emailed you but I just want to say something positive before you make a wrong choice. Plus my phone is harder to email on but if you need to talk feel free to email me.

My advice: Don't hurt yourself. It's not worth it. You have a purpose here, regardless of what assholes keep telling you.


I hope and pray that you don't hurt yourself or anyone else. I know sometimes life throws monkey wrenches at people but in order to be happy, you just need God and yourself. At least for me that's all I need but you might be different but that's ok too.

Count yourself lucky if you have somewhere to stay right now, and if you don't, I know what that's like too. Whatever rejection that comes your way just,"shake it off." like Taylor swift wrote.

Life is rough but it gets better and I hope you know that happiness is what you make it. Just like in church today my pastor was talking about how our thoughts are a result of life. 

So if you keep thinking nobody cares you would be wrong. There's someone out there that luvs you rather it be ur mom or gf or whoever just be grateful. Jesus loves you. And he died for us all.

I'm a total stranger but I'm a rare one that cares for human life and if you ever need to chat just through email, I'm cool with it.
I make a bad ass friend. 

You can ask anyone that knows and luvs me I've been through a lot but just recently my doctor has informed me that I'm happier now, just by knowing God and not forcing my beliefs on others just living my own life. 

I will pray for you and I hope this emotional pain your feeling fades quickly. 

God bless!

title: 40 year old adventurous nerd seeks same
text:
I am a 40 year old woman who works full-time and goes to school full-time (Master's degree in social work). I'm not a parent but have raised kids (long story). I have a great boyfriend and a couple of good friends, but life often gets in the way of us hanging out so I'm looking to increase the friend supply, so to speak. 

I love to do "stuff", meaning I'm easily entertained. I love to learn and try new things but really enjoy what I call "exploring". I enjoy hiking, finding ghost towns (photographing them although I haven't done it in a while), road trips, going places just because I've never been and asking questions like "hey, I wonder where this road goes?". I am not very feminine. Doing my hair involves washing, drying, brushing it and done. My dream car is a lifted Jeep with a winch (I currently have a wimpy Jeep but it gets me down those roads I wander). I do my own remodeling work on my house, enjoy DIY projects and crafts. I don't care for shopping. Dirt and hard work don't scare me. I love horror movies and Halloween (Yay Walking Dead!). I love conversations about anything interesting...and I find almost anything interesting. I am a "dog person". I prefer nature and small towns over the city.

I'm not into going out for drinks because I'm not much of a drinker and don't like bars. I'm not religious or very spiritual although I love talking about those topics from a nerdy or academic standpoint. I don't smoke and am in fact very allergic to it. Don't smoke pot although I'm not against it. I'm not into drama and am looking for friends only, nothing more. I don't care if you're "fit" or not, I'm not "fit" but am not lazy either. I think it's odd when I see that caveat in CL friends posts....."fit and attractive".....uhhhh....so what. This is a friends post, not online dating.

I also have sarcastic humor, if you didn't pick up on that just now. 

So if you're looking for a friend to go do "stuff" with, and I sound like someone you could stand to go do that stuff with, send me an email.

title: Mostly Strictly Platonic!
text:
Ha... well, maybe not STRICTLY platonic (but we'll start there). No reasonable person worth meeting EVER posts or looks in the "let's go have sex" categories, this is true! :)

Seeking an attractive, fit, and interesting woman, age 40-60 who is also looking for friendship, and occasionally getting together for a walk, a talk, a lunch, a croissant & Espresso, a bike ride, a couple hours out listening to live music. Casual romance is a possibility, but absolutely NOT a requirement or expectation. You do not have to be in a relationship, but it will probably be easier that way, so we have the same limitations and both have a strong motivation towards discretion. Again, this would be casual, no expectations, I am not looking for someone who wants to get serious, but I do like the idea of a long-term friendship, if we develop that kind of connection. 

I am smart, fit, nice looking (I look young for my age, and I take care of myself), artistic, and a good listener and talker. I have a very flexible schedule, live in central Denver, love to walk and bike, and love an excuse to go out to some of these new great restaurants Denver keeps getting. I like dogs. I have a dry sense of humor, and lots of passion. Lots.

I prefer a non-smoker, open-minded, who is "conscious-but-not-self-conscious", who can talk about spiritual & philosophical things and even religion or politics without getting crazy. Self confidence, a zest for living and lots of interests. 

Email me, and you will get my story of why this posting... and remember: Strange & wonderful things happen every day!

title: Searching for more ease with your life?
text:
Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

Touch one Bar and you begin to clear away the energy locked up in that area or aspect of your life just by touching it, clearing the space for new awareness to come in.

The creative possibilities for your life begin to open up!

It's been said that at worst a Bars session will feel like a great massage. At best, it will change your life!

More questions? Check out this link:

http://access-consciousness-blog.com/2011/02/frequently-asked-questions-about-the-bars/


Are you interested in seeing what a 60 or 90 minute Bars session can do for you?

Reply to this ad to find out more.

title: Stuck in life in CA, consider CO
text:
So I'm a 26 year old guy out in California, I'm unhappy here and not really able to find work, even through temp agencies.
Shit sucks for me and it just gets me depressed.
I honestly have no money, all I have is the clothes on my back, my car and a dozen boxes of my personal belongings in a spare bedroom at my grandfathers who's letting me stay here because it's better than living out on the streets or in my car.

I tried to move away in 2014. I went to Seattle, I loved it! Being somewhere new and different just filled me with different feelings and I liked that. I felt like anywhere but California is where I belong. Unfortunately I had to go back because I couldn't get a job quick enough. Oh well.

I took a quick look and saw that studios are as low as $600 a month and thought "yo that's perfect. I do not care about a one bedroom, I eat and sleep in the same room here at my grandfathers already. I'm used to small living quarters." And I've got some experience with maintenance and some porter work and noticed jobs for apartments needing people.
I have some tools of my own, I can turn over an apartment with some help, I'm not good enough to do it alone yet but I'm not afraid to do work. I still have a lot to learn though. 

I just...I'm hating my life and myself here every passing day and I want to get away from this feeling. I just wish I could pack up and move out there to Denver but I won't get far with what little I have now and I don't have a computer, only this iPhone with a cracked screen. 
I thought I'd maybe post here and see if I could make a friend or just find someone to talk to.

title: Church buddy for Saturday nights
text:
Hello!

I'll spare you the long version of my story -- until you ask -- but let's just say that for reasons related to my marriage and my divorce, I find myself nearly completely disconnected from the world. I also find my faith waning. I have a couple of good guy friends, but they're married and otherwise occupied most of the time.

I don't really know why I am searching for a woman to buddy up with me for church friend-dates on Saturday. I CAN promise you that I am NOT interested in a physical or romantic relationship. I want a real friend, like I haven't had since I was about twenty-one. I miss sitting in front of one other person, sharing all my bull-s%&t and not being judged. I miss causing myself shame (not really) but having a friend to sit across from me, listen to my story, and share an empathetic look with me. I guess I want a real friend, maybe a bff if we really hit it off.

About me: I'm a 36-year-old divorced father of two who is not looking for romance or intimate connection right now; getting back into the world of the living is where I want to start. I used to play soccer (and would like to still) and wrestle, and I love writing. I have started and gotten fifteen to twenty pages in on about fifty books over the course of my life. I am also a teacher, although I am currently questioning that path. I love to have fun, but I am a hurting soul and am both a little awkward and a little uptight at times. I want to find that happy spark again, and I think having friends, paired with the joy of my children, is the ticket.

Let me know if you live on the west side of town (Arvada, Wheatridge, Littleton, Lakewood, Golden, etc.) and would like to spend part of Saturday evenings worshiping God.

Cheers!

title: Looking for a good friend
text:
Re-posting this.

Hi my name is Adam. Since this is a CL personal's ad, let me first be clear on one point: I am NOT on here looking for sex. Not now, not down the road once you know me better. If that's what you think friendship is, well there are (and unfortunately from my viewpoint) a lot of posts from people who agree with you. Try them.

Now that that is out of the way, let me tell you a little of who I am and why I AM posting on here. It will be the first time I've done so. I'm posting on here because I believe the world we live in makes deep and intimate human connection difficult and therefore hard to come by, at least for me. Honestly, I don't know how to build a real friendship when for many people, the occasional "like" on Facebook or "LOL" text message constitutes friendship. That and all the rules that forbid men from getting close to one another physically, emotionally, spiritually, or any other _ally unless they are into homosexuality. Sorry, but I reject both the notions of superficial non-connected friendships as well as the opposite that "real men" only interact in fist bumps and bro-hugs and don't actually have any kind of feelings or need for anyone but themselves unless for sex.

What I wish I had right now was a friend, about my age, who feels as deeply about things (and other people) as I do. Who isn't afraid to show it. Who isn't afraid to talk to about hard things, but whom I can also go out and do things with, be real with, have fun with, and feel like said friend desires and values me as a friend as much as I value him. I'll be honest, there are some hard things in my life, some that I haven't completely figured out yet. I wouldn't be on here posting that I need friends if that were not the case. But as I said, I also would love to have another man to just do things with. I like racquetball, ping pong, camping, hiking, volleyball, disc golf. I love conversation, and I don't avoid the difficult topics. But I find that I sit around entirely too much since I haven't found anyone to do any of that with. A little help on that front would be appreciated.

I should also say that I have deep convictions about a lot of things, religious, moral, political to name a few, and am not afraid to discuss those topics, as long as it stays respectful. But those convictions also are a way of life for me. I try my best to actually live according to my beliefs, though I often fail at it. On that note, I don't drink or smoke anything so meeting up for a drink or 420 isn't my thing.

If you likewise want such a friend, I may be your man. Just so you have a little more idea of who I am, I'm 29, from South Carolina, but live in Centennial now (near at least some places in Aurora). I am looking for friends around my age (say 20s to about 35 maybe). Not that I mind older people, I just feel I need a peer more than a mentor. I travel a lot for work, which sadly means I'm sometimes gone for a few days at a time, hence at least part of the hard time finding steady friendships in my life.

I probably am one of the more unusual men you'll ever meet. I guess a man who looks for other men in CL ads for anything other than sex is already a little weird, but hey, you're looking in the platonic section too, so let's be weird together. If you'd like to talk more or meet up, feel free to email back. We can start there.

title: Hiking, Fitness & Drinks!
text:
Greetings Fellas,

New to Denver from the east coast and looking to make some new friends around town - preferably near Capitol Hill or downtown Denver. 

About Me: 
27 years old, full time professional, have a masters degree, love travel, working out, surfing and getting outdoors for some hiking or snowshoeing. I'm also interested in the arts, politics - not a huge sports fan, but like to get out and catch a game every now and then - and having long philosophical talks about life. Have a girlfriend, and not looking for any kind of friends with benefits - just pals! I like to dress well, but don't go overboard about it - basically, I'm a very friendly, active, smart, well dressed, Mr Perfect! Far from it, but Hey, you can try right?

What I'm Looking for: 
Basically, I'm looking for a young guy similar in age, and work situation to me who is also looking to make new friends in Denver. Ideally, you are looking for guy / guys to go hiking with, hang out and grab a few beers on the weekend, watch some Netflix and talk about life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness. I go to Club Form Fitness downtown on 17th and if you also go there and we can put in a workout together - awesome. If you like Bodyspace, but aren't a meat head - we should be friends.

Feel free to reach out on here - send a picture of yourself if you like, or describe yourself if you like, and lets grab a drink or a burger sometime. Always great to meet new people.

title: Female for compensated cuddling?
text:
I'm looking to make a connection with a girl in the Metro Denver area who'd be willing to entertain the possibility of cuddling with me, once some rapport and comfort have been established through a progression of emails, then texts, and finalizing with a coffee date. I would like to set a date of April 4th for our first actual cuddle. This gives me an opportunity to weed out professionals, girls just looking for cash, and spam. I am open to hosting, or cuddling at your place... I'd prefer mine. 

For the most part, this cuddling will be generally platonic- and under no circumstances will there ever be any request or expectation of nudity, or anything that could be described using the word "job". Outside of that, I'd like some potential for boundaries to be flexible within those non-negotiables. My initial impression (for a first session) is something along the lines of us laying on my couch, with a blanket over us, snuggled up in front of my wood burning fire place. We'll be wearing comfortable clothes (flannel pants and tshirts/tank tops?). I'll be the "big spoon" and will hold you in my muscular arms with quiet, chill music playing. We'll talk politics, relationships, the human condition... or just quietly hum along with the music. 

You are welcome to keep in contact via phone with whomever you need consistently throughout our cuddling session. I'm not against the idea of you having a friend waiting for you. I'm really looking for someone who can cuddle with me once or twice a month, for a few hours, for a flat rate of $200/cash. 

Here's where I invite questions and concerns about my post, my intentions or my reasoning for offering money for this. Questions about sexual favors won't be entertained or discussed. What I can say is this- this is really about affection and relaxation. The closeness of a man and a woman in this context definitely implies some degree of sexuality. Let's figure that out, but once again... no "jobs" and no nudity and no touching anything that is covered with underwear.... I think that makes things easier to figure, now.

Anyway, at this point I'm rambling. I think my intent and integrity are yours to question. 

To get an immediate reply- please include a pic or two (fully clothed, one that gives an idea of your body type), and some return contact info. I've included a phone number that takes text messages, so that is available as well.

title: Tall and slender seeks tall and slender friend!
text:
I have a number of close female friends, and unquestionably prefer the company of women to men in most cases. But once, just once, I'd love to find a highly compatible female companion who, like me, is tall (5' 9" and up) and slender -- someone who relates to what that means in terms of doorways, buying a car, or finding properly fitting jeans or long-enough sleeves. (If you smiled when you read that, you should probably consider getting in touch. :))

Open as far as age is concerned (I'm mid 50s, but don't look it, feel it, live it or get taken for it, ever). Prefer someone caucasian, cute/attractive, at least reasonably fit, intelligent, thoughtful, joyful, well read, upbeat/optimistic, open minded, easygoing, balanced, great sense of humor, an excellent conversationalist, self-aware (as opposed to self-absorbed), and eternally curious about the world around her. Being health-conscious, semi- to fully vegetarian, spiritually inclined (as opposed to 'religious'), at least somewhat liberal politically, and a lover of nature, the outdoors, travel, and the written word would be major pluses.

Obviously I too am tall (6' 2") and slender (165), as well as single, caucasian, clean cut and clean shaven, fit, attractive, casually professional, with most/all of the characteristics referenced in the paragraph above. Oh, and I don't smoke (not even 420) or use any kind of drug, and would prefer that you not either. Living relatively close to one another would seem wise too in this case, as I think of it.

This being Craigslist, I realize it's unlikely the friend I seek can be found here. Then again, I suspect there are many like me who have never posted or responded to a post before because they've viewed the ads on CL, many quite off-putting, and are convinced no one they'd care to know could ever be found here...

title: Fun, active girlfriends wanted!
text:
I've met a few cool people via Craigslist in the past, so I figured it was worth a shot to write my own ad so I can describe myself and the type of people I'm hoping to meet. If you are a flaky person who claims you want new friends but is never going to want to do anything other than be a hermit, please do not waste my time. 

To keep it brief, I'm looking for friends around my age who don't have kids and are fairly active. No offense to you if you have kids, but I have enough friends with them who can never commit to plans. If you're married/in a relationship, that's cool too, since maybe we can all hang out. I'm not looking for smoking buddies or people who only want to get together if it involves eating/drinking/sitting at a bar. I'll go to a happy hour on random occasions but I'm not a big drinker and would rather get to know someone by doing something fun instead of sitting at a noisy bar with a bunch of sloppy people. 

My husband and I try to go hiking as much as possible, but it's day hiking type stuff - I'll never be camping in a tent for a week because I have a screwed up back. I'm trying to motivate myself to get back into running since I like 5Ks, and haven't been running much since we moved to CO last year. The dry air still kills me even though I will never miss the humidity of the East Coast! I'm sarcastic, honest, analytical, and a fairly type A person. I consider myself introverted but I like meeting new people on an individual basis. I love zoos, baking and traveling as much as humanly possible. I need independent friends who aren't reliant on their husbands/boyfriends/whoever and like to do new things. 

I do live outside of Colorado Springs on the NE side, but am hoping there are some women on the southern side of Denver that might be in the same boat since I have no issue with driving or meeting in between. I've been here for a little over a year and have yet to meet many people I click with, so maybe you're reading this right now...and if you are, email me and let's talk!

"Simple, no frills, down to earth Tauruian guy!"

I'm not looking for anything more than a platonic (friends only) relationship. I like to consider myself a pretty chilled out guy. I work for myself so I set my own schedule.

title: Beyond the ordinary
text:
Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to read my post. For some time now, it's been clear my circle of friends has grown smaller, and those I do have are shifting. I am feeling less connected than many years ago when we began our friendship. Though they are dear to me, I am finding myself longing for a connection with another who values not only intellect, attending to physical body's needs (e.g. exercise, sustenance) but also has a desire to be better than he is today. I am seeking someone who finds gratitude in the smallest of things (e.g. the sunshine, the water, the contributions others have made to his life) and wants to share in that kindling of a new friendship to create new opportunities of gratitude and sharing

A little bit more about me: Single, blk, gay (though you do not have to be), 41. I like intimate coffee talks and smaller venues to get to know others, non-drug user, non-smoker to include 420, rarely drink. I also enjoy reading specifically books on dreams, hiking, exercise, good company, good movies. I find that for me it's not about the activities but the people I share those activities with that determine if I am having a good time.

Who I would like to meet: people with life experiences that have strengthened them but have also provided them with humility, those who know there is more to life than just the daily grind, those looking to connect with quality individuals and have their lives bettered for knowing another human in the world, those who have a great sense of humor but is also kind in their humor, and those who can challenge me to being a better person as I will challenge them out of my commitment to support others in being the best they can.

If interested, please say hello. Until our paths cross, I wish you all the best life has to offer.

title: Here's to Eventually Dying Alone
text:
I'm introverted by nature, I take great comfort in my privacy and I find silence to be a bliss. Needless to say, I love being alone. I detest loud places and loud people. Once or twice a week I enjoy the company of a friend and nothing makes me happier than having someone to constantly email back and forth with or to have a conversation over Skype at the end of the day.

I'm not anti-social and I'm far from shy. At a glance I might come off as a welcome mat with the patience of a saint; fortunately that is not the case. I simply don't care about anything as a result nothing ever gets to me. I'm being deported next year and I can't decide whether I want a 3 piece charcoal suit or a rust / burgundy sport coat and some really nice shoes. When my grandfather passed away, that entire day I couldn't help but wonder if I left the stove on before leaving the house. 

From my perspective, an ideal day starts off with reading random articles online, followed by a workout secession in a non crowded gym, cooking a new exotic recipe for dinner and ending with watching a good movie in front of my monitor.

I have two amazing friends who I have great respect for, unfortunately most of the time they feel more like acquaintances due to the lack of ever wanting to spend time on weekends or talk or email during the weekdays. In short, I have no friends. I'm sure If I had friends they would give me a catchy nick name like Rooster, not many people call me Rooster, in fact no one calls me Rooster, it's depressing. 

I don't need sex but I always welcome it, I'm always in the mood. I get an escort every week, I always pick one with short hair, preferably one that can pull off the tomboy look. Sometimes I pick a guy with a feminine complexion and long hair. 

If you're a lesbian we'll get along just swell, if you're a straight women then it's only a matter of time before I offer you a couple thousand to sleep with me - it's landed me in jail before, so with all due respect I will go to great lengths to avoid you. If you're a bisexual guy then you might just be a potential candidate for best friend. Please note: I don't sleep with my male friends. Above all be under 25 years of age. 

If you have any questions, soliloquies, grievances, death threats, what ever it may be please don't hesitate to ask. DO NOT send me a picture of yourself, otherwise I will judge you and end up ignoring you. I will reply to all and any emails with in the same day. 

The picture I posted is a painting I saw at the Denver museum of art, the piece captured my attention in a way most porn can't. Despite the dark image it depicts, I find it to be beautiful.

title: Anyone Up For Creating A Piece Of Heaven On Earth In Hawaii?
text:
Hello, and thank you for taking the time to view my ad. I am wanting to move to the big island of Hawaii. I want to live off-grid, complete with water catchment, solar power, grow a completely organic year around garden and orchard. I also have a deep desire to help others in some way. Not sure how that will end up being. But I can definitely see giving away fruit from the orchard that I couldn't possibly consume on my own. I would also like to produce tea tree oil for it's homeopathic benefits.

I was originally going to move to Hawaii with my soon to be ex-wife, and daughter. But they changed their minds, so now I am on my own in this adventure. Which I am fine with. I just wanted to put this out there. In case there is someone out there that is like minded, that would like to join forces in something like this. As I tend to believe where two or more are gathered with the same intents and purposes, real magic can happen. So this is basically a test for echo. (Yes I am a Rush fan.)

So a little about me. I am a 46 year old male. I am not gay, bi, or remotely curious. Just so that is clear right from the start. As I would not be opposed to joining forces with another man that may have interest in the same thing. As long as we are like minded, and can work as a team. I am very spiritual, and believe full heatedly in signs and synchronicities. So much so, that they pretty much lead me in my life. So if you can't handle crazy synchronicities going on around you all of the time, I am definitely not the right person for you to team up with. 

I am also a musician/singer/song writter. I mostly play the keyboards/piano now. So if you wouldn't like listening to me play around 3 times a week. This probably wouldn't be a good fit either. (I don't want to have to use headphone all of the time.) A fellow musician would be great! I am dealing with some health issues currently, that I am hoping I will be able to get past. But typically I am a very athletic person. Love playing several different sports. Like to garden, be out in nature, etc.. 

Very mild mannered. I hate to argue, tension, negativity, etc.. I do not like to watch a lot of violence, or listen to angry/negative music, etc.. I like being in a positive uplifting atmosphere overall. My mantra is to become pure positive energy. The law I live by, is Do No Harm. More specifically, don't harm other people spiritually, emotionally, physically, or financially. If we can agree to live by that together, and communicate effectively whenever any issues do come up. Coming from a place, where we have a trust that the other person would never do anything to harm the other intentionally. That in my opinion, is a rock hard foundation to build any relationship on. 

But I am ready for a transition in my life, I am ready to live my life the way I have wanted to live it for a long time. I want to better myself, and become the best person that I can be. So if you feel like you are ready for a break from the craziness that is our society, and maybe create a little piece of Heaven here on Earth with me. Please let me know, I would love to compare notes, etc., to find a good fit. I could use a life long friend, could you be it? Especially if you have a desire to help others.

Thank you for your time, and consideration,
Dan

title: The wanderer
text:
Good friend's are a rare thing.
This ad isn't for everyone, even most people.
I'm not your typical guy.

This is truly meant to stay a friendship, not putting limitations on things.
I made the choice to stay single, out of the need to examine my behavior.
One thing that was quickly realized Is the need for healthy friendships with women.

However in this I do not seek a shallow friendship.
I have a lot of value for honesty and openness. Generally being able to share what's going on in one another's lives. I am a very emotional person actually, so speaking from the heart happens a lot.

I have no time what ever for superficial conversation.

I'm more on the "spiritual" end of things. As a practitioner of Buddhism I meditate daily. If you happen to meditate that's awesome, if not that's cool too.
Practice is very central, so you certainly will here about it. In a respectful way, not beliefs being pushed around or anything like that.

Self love is a big one here, this is a basic of self realization.
How we view are ourselves is intimately tied to how we view others.

Being present is also a big deal. Being able to put down the cell phone, the other distractions, in general and be here, be now. If you are at a place where being distracted or entertained constantly is of value. Our interaction would be of little value. I consider alcohol and weed distractions. I am not going to judge you for what you do, please though don't do these things around me.

I like getting outdoors, a Lot!
I'm open to all kinds of adventures really, just as long as it doesn't involve, bars, movie theatres, clubs, this kinda thing.

A few practical notes, it is preferred you are single, if not please disclose. Though being single isn't mandatory, it tends to complicate things if you're not, I'd like to know.
Also I will NOT BE your texting buddy, who you never see. Please make sure you have time to have a friend. Please also make sure you are prepared to meet fairly quickly, I have no desire for a prolonged email exchange.
