title: reply: please pray for me
text:
Dear,

Guy that's considering suicide. 

I just caught your post. I don't normally post here much and I would have emailed you but I just want to say something positive before you make a wrong choice. Plus my phone is harder to email on but if you need to talk feel free to email me.

My advice: Don't hurt yourself. It's not worth it. You have a purpose here, regardless of what assholes keep telling you.


I hope and pray that you don't hurt yourself or anyone else. I know sometimes life throws monkey wrenches at people but in order to be happy, you just need God and yourself. At least for me that's all I need but you might be different but that's ok too.

Count yourself lucky if you have somewhere to stay right now, and if you don't, I know what that's like too. Whatever rejection that comes your way just,"shake it off." like Taylor swift wrote.

Life is rough but it gets better and I hope you know that happiness is what you make it. Just like in church today my pastor was talking about how our thoughts are a result of life. 

So if you keep thinking nobody cares you would be wrong. There's someone out there that luvs you rather it be ur mom or gf or whoever just be grateful. Jesus loves you. And he died for us all.

I'm a total stranger but I'm a rare one that cares for human life and if you ever need to chat just through email, I'm cool with it.
I make a bad ass friend. 

You can ask anyone that knows and luvs me I've been through a lot but just recently my doctor has informed me that I'm happier now, just by knowing God and not forcing my beliefs on others just living my own life. 

I will pray for you and I hope this emotional pain your feeling fades quickly. 

God bless!

title: 40 year old adventurous nerd seeks same
text:
I am a 40 year old woman who works full-time and goes to school full-time (Master's degree in social work). I'm not a parent but have raised kids (long story). I have a great boyfriend and a couple of good friends, but life often gets in the way of us hanging out so I'm looking to increase the friend supply, so to speak. 

I love to do "stuff", meaning I'm easily entertained. I love to learn and try new things but really enjoy what I call "exploring". I enjoy hiking, finding ghost towns (photographing them although I haven't done it in a while), road trips, going places just because I've never been and asking questions like "hey, I wonder where this road goes?". I am not very feminine. Doing my hair involves washing, drying, brushing it and done. My dream car is a lifted Jeep with a winch (I currently have a wimpy Jeep but it gets me down those roads I wander). I do my own remodeling work on my house, enjoy DIY projects and crafts. I don't care for shopping. Dirt and hard work don't scare me. I love horror movies and Halloween (Yay Walking Dead!). I love conversations about anything interesting...and I find almost anything interesting. I am a "dog person". I prefer nature and small towns over the city.

I'm not into going out for drinks because I'm not much of a drinker and don't like bars. I'm not religious or very spiritual although I love talking about those topics from a nerdy or academic standpoint. I don't smoke and am in fact very allergic to it. Don't smoke pot although I'm not against it. I'm not into drama and am looking for friends only, nothing more. I don't care if you're "fit" or not, I'm not "fit" but am not lazy either. I think it's odd when I see that caveat in CL friends posts....."fit and attractive".....uhhhh....so what. This is a friends post, not online dating.

I also have sarcastic humor, if you didn't pick up on that just now. 

So if you're looking for a friend to go do "stuff" with, and I sound like someone you could stand to go do that stuff with, send me an email.

So I'm a 26 year old guy out in California, I'm unhappy here and not really able to find work, even through temp agencies.
Shit sucks for me and it just gets me depressed.
I honestly have no money, all I have is the clothes on my back, my car and a dozen boxes of my personal belongings in a spare bedroom at my grandfathers who's letting me stay here because it's better than living out on the streets or in my car.

I tried to move away in 2014. I went to Seattle, I loved it! Being somewhere new and different just filled me with different feelings and I liked that. I felt like anywhere but California is where I belong. Unfortunately I had to go back because I couldn't get a job quick enough. Oh well.

I took a quick look and saw that studios are as low as $600 a month and thought "yo that's perfect. I do not care about a one bedroom, I eat and sleep in the same room here at my grandfathers already. I'm used to small living quarters." And I've got some experience with maintenance and some porter work and noticed jobs for apartments needing people.
I have some tools of my own, I can turn over an apartment with some help, I'm not good enough to do it alone yet but I'm not afraid to do work. I still have a lot to learn though. 

I just...I'm hating my life and myself here every passing day and I want to get away from this feeling. I just wish I could pack up and move out there to Denver but I won't get far with what little I have now and I don't have a computer, only this iPhone with a cracked screen.
